I was completely put off by my 6 dollar burrito filled with tasteless rice and sub par meat (I wouldn't even try my boyfriend's sad-looking little fish taco or my friend's "crispy" taco with a shell that looked as though it came straight from an Old El Paso box via the microwave) and the fact that I could find no redeeming qualities in any of this food says a lot.

* The mistakes.  I was floored.  My boyfriend ordered a side of guacamole that never materialized.  3 of our 4 orders had something wrong, from run of the mill errors like the wrong kind of beans to pretty unforgivable grievances like serving the wrong kind of taco altogether.  But the final nail in the Iron Cactus coffin was that our waiter, upon asking how we were doing (big mistake, buddy), listened to us explain our problems then pulled a disappearing act the likes of which I've never seen.  Not a single one of our many issues was addressed.  I felt bad for him because he's probably been dealing with this crap since the day he started -- but that doesn't mean I don't want that 5 dollars worth of guacamole you forgot.

* The menu.  Take a look at it on their website (http://ironcactussf.com/menu.php) and you'll start to understand what's going on here.  Spelling and punctuation errors (they sure do like their apostrophes) everywhere.  The chart of order options is mind boggling.  You've got to learn to crawl before you can walk.   

I beg you Iron Cactus:  take these reviews seriously and shape up.  You have the potential to bag so many loyal customers at this location, and I would have been one of them had you served me anything even close to what I can get for a lower price in the Mission, with even a modicum of precision in your service.  And if there's anyone out there who is reading this and thinking  "Meh, I shall eschew the Yelp collective's early impressions and will strike out on my own to try this place because for ME it will be different" I beg *you*:  save your money and wait it out.

excerpts: I have a myriad of intestinal disorders that make me able to only eat certain foods and the burrito bowl with guacamole
does me right every time.
I learned I was also lactose intolerant which a lot of people don't know they are and blame Mexican food when in fact, it's that they're lactose intolerant and should skip the sour cream!
The Iron Cactus does me right
burrito.author: Brent S.
burrito.review:
I live and work near The Iron Cactus and I eat there about 5 times a week. The food is great and the owners are friendly and always recognize me and make me feel welcome.

I have a myriad of intestinal disorders that make me able to only eat certain foods and the burrito bowl with guacamole does me right every time. I learned I was also lactose intolerant which a lot of people don't know they are and blame Mexican food when in fact, it's that they're lactose intolerant and should skip the sour cream! The Iron Cactus does me right and I have about one of the most sensitive guts out there.

I don't see why they don't have a 5 star rating - when the ball games are packing the place, sure, every business gets slow when you have a line out the door it seems like any place takes a long time - this place is worth the wait, every time.

excerpts: My chicken burrito was $6.95 + Tax and some tip.
Press your fingers together and you will get a size of the diameter -
yes
it was small and poorly rolled (poor quality control).
The chicken was flavorless albeit not dried out, rice/beans - meh, flour tortilla was ordinary, sour cream was added without my consent or asking.
Add those together
and you get a terrible burrito.
The workers were poorly trained as evident by the poor construction of the burrito and lack of communication.
burrito.author: Francois M.
burrito.review:
I could find better tasting Mexican food in the frozen isle at the local grocery store. Its conveniently located at the corner of 4th and Townsend but if you have any taste for Mexican food you are going to be thoroughly disappointed. 

My chicken burrito was $6.95 + Tax and some tip. Press your fingers together and you will get a size of the diameter - yes it was small and poorly rolled (poor quality control). The chicken was flavorless albeit not dried out, rice/beans - meh, flour tortilla was ordinary, sour cream was added without my consent or asking. Add those together and you get a terrible burrito. Luke warm, mushy, untasty and totally dissatisfying. 

The workers were poorly trained as evident by the poor construction of the burrito and lack of communication. It saddens me how I could go on rambling about how terrible this place is but I truly hope they can shape up and serve some quality food as its conveniently next door to my work.

Best of luck to the management and making things better.

excerpts:
I just had to vent a bit before I sit down to eat my Spicy Chicken Burrito--to go.

If the burrito place is going to operate as a micro-police-state they should post the rules and regulations to which she referred.
burrito.author: Brian D.
burrito.review:
First Impressions can unfortunately be so Damning. 

The place looks nice, the food looks ordinary (taste test pending) I just had to vent a bit before I sit down to eat my Spicy Chicken Burrito--to go.

I live in the neighborhood and was delighted when I learned that  a new taqueria was opening so close to home.  I wanted to send a visual to my partner who is away on business. We had both been looking forward to giving the place a try. As I was making an MMS to send on my phone, a woman behind the counter said, "Sir, your not allowed to video-tape in here." I asked her why, to which she replied with some tone, and some mild swivel-head,"because its the rules!" 

So, I have to wonder, why in the hell can't you make a video in a taqeiria?! Some fear of liability? Is the place not built to code? Are the workers secretly famous and avoiding the paparazzi? It was a real turn off. If the burrito place is going to operate as a micro-police-state they should post the rules and regulations to which she referred. 

As it stands now, unless the food is absolutely delicious, I'll take a pass on this joint here on out.

excerpts: Taco/burrito?   -   Go to the Mission,
burrito.author: Alex D.
burrito.review:
Anyone who has allotted this place more than two stars was either drunk while eating or has some how avoided the myriad of other Mexican dining options in SF. 

Want a cheap Taco/burrito?   -   Go to the Mission, almost any place on Mission will blow this place out of the water. 

Want actual Mexican food with actual service?   -  Go to Nopalito, for what you get it's a hell of a lot better value than Iron Cactus and is some of the best food in the City. 

Want something better than Iron Cactus?   -  Well go to freaking Chili's or Chipotle, because even they make the Iron Cactus look like crap.

With only 30 minutes before our show at AT&T Park Abby Z. and I were looking for a quick bite, enter Iron Cactus: Cute, warm, decently busy for a Wednesday night. Running out on time we went in and ordered. The place is set up like Chipotle you order and pay at the counter and than go sit down. I wouldn't call this place cheap by a long shot; Abby's tacos were like $3.79 each, and my salad was $8.50. I got a four dollar beer and we munched on some chips, things were looking good, than appears the food:

My $8.50 chicken salad was a lame handful of romaine in a bowl adorned with a few red onion rings, some dry-ass chicken, and a scattering of corn and beans. I 'm not a huge eater, but when you pay $8.50 at an order-at-the-counter Mexican place you expect an entree, not an appetizer, or  at the very least you expect your small portion to be excellent and not totally tasteless. 

The tacos were cafeteria grade, complete with those junky pre-formed crispy taco shells you can buy at Safeway (yuk!). Where this place gets off serving this food in SF, home to some of the best Mexican cooking America, or why it appeared people living in the area were dining here remains a mystery to me. Let it be a mystery to you too and don't set foot in the Iron Cactus.

excerpts: Five stars for bringing a mission burrito out of the mission.
Name another place you can get a burrito of this quality in SOMA, especially a block from caltrain.
Chavos?
Not even close.
Tres Agaves?
Nope.
Luna Taqueria?
El Norteno Truck?
Maybe if they're open.
All I know is that Iron Cactus is a regular part of my eating schedule.
burrito.author: Cameron M.
burrito.review:
Five stars for bringing a mission burrito out of the mission. The reviews here make me lose a lot of faith in Yelp: I've eaten here four times since their opening and while the service and ordering need some work, the food is always consistently delicious (not surprising given that the chef came from Pancho Villa).

Without getting into the religious debate around mission burritos, this is certainly in the range of others, and after a few months I imagine they will be a solid contender.

Name another place you can get a burrito of this quality in SOMA, especially a block from caltrain. Chavos? Not even close. Tres Agaves? Nope. Luna Taqueria? El Norteno Truck? Maybe if they're open. All I know is that Iron Cactus is a regular part of my eating schedule.

excerpts: I can think of six places to get basically the same burrito within a two block radius of this location.
In the 4 1/2 years I've worked in the neighborhood, I've typically just gone to whatever was closest.
burrito.author: Amy A.
burrito.review:
I really really like Iron Cactus.  I think the food and sauces are delicious.  My favorite are the enchiladas, although the spicy shrimp salad is pretty fantastic.  They use quality, fresh ingredients, focus on healthier dishes and are not afraid to make things spicy!

There is plenty of seating and the interior is cute.  I wish they had made a little more standing room for those waiting for take-out, though.  Today, I felt like I was in the way while they prepared my lunch.

It's hard to make Mexican food in San Francisco that is differentiated from all the other Mexican food in this town.  I can think of six places to get basically the same burrito within a two block radius of this location.  In the 4 1/2 years I've worked in the neighborhood, I've typically just gone to whatever was closest.  However, I'm willing to walk to Iron Cactus. 

I really hope to see them make it!

excerpts: I switch back and forth between the burrito bowl and the enchilada plate - you can't go wrong either way!
burrito.author: Sarah R.
burrito.review:
We love the Iron Cactus. 

My husband, 2 y.o. son and I come in about once a week - my son would live off of their rice and black beans if we allowed him to! We're always greeted with a smile. 

Food is great - everything is perfectly seasoned and hits the spot when you're craving Mexican food. I switch back and forth between the burrito bowl and the enchilada plate - you can't go wrong either way!

We recently had our son's birthday party on their patio and it couldn't have been more perfect. We took suggestions on the food and layout from Ivor, the owner, and he hit it out of the ball park going above and beyond our expectations. There was plenty of yummy food, the weather was perfect, and the space was ideal for little kids - the back door to the patio was closed, so the kids had a safe, contained play space. The adults had plenty of sangria and beer, and no one left hungry! Sal, our host/server, worked hard to ensure we had everything we needed. It was a fantastic day.

Do consider the Iron Cactus for your next party or get-together. It really is a gem right here in SOMA!

excerpts: Almost $10 for a burrito?
Really?
Seriously??
burrito.author: OakMama D.
burrito.review:
Muy expsensivo.  I went in when it was totally empty at 3 for a late lunch snack. I decided to give the nachos a try because it was happy hour and they were only $2.  Well they took forever and I couldn't believe it but they microwaved them.  I can do that at home, thank you very much.  It was mediocre. 

And, I looked at the menu to come back for other stuff.  Almost $10 for a burrito?  Really? Seriously??  No es bueno.

Doubt I'll be back.  Instead will be going to Mexico au Parc in South Park which is AWESOME and a good value for your money.

Adios, Iron Cactus...

excerpts: I ordered the burrito with carne asada, my boyfriend ordered the burrito with chili verde and we shared a small order of guacamole and tortilla chips!
I really enjoyed my burrito.
It wasn't monstrously huge, but still filling.
I killed it because I was starving from a light lunch!
The guacamole was okay...
I think I like Chipotle's guac better.
burrito.author: Christine E.
burrito.review:
I'm surprised with the low ratings of this place.  I actually thought it was good.  I've lived in the SOMA area for a little more than a year now and am always in search of a Mexican joint in the area.  I'm very excited that we now have this place to stop by for some Mexican eats.

We came here on a rainy night while the power was out due to the thunderstorms in the Bay Area this week.  We checked it out to see if it was open and although it was dimly lit due to the power outage, we saw a good number of patrons having their dinner and service staff at the counter.  It was so on!  We were encouraged by the fact that they were still open and were able to serve hot food.

I ordered the burrito with carne asada, my boyfriend ordered the burrito with chili verde and we shared a small order of guacamole and tortilla chips!  I really enjoyed my burrito.  It wasn't monstrously huge, but still filling.  I killed it because I was starving from a light lunch!  The guacamole was okay...I think I like Chipotle's guac better.  But, the guac here was satisfactory, along with the mild and hot fresh salsa.

I can't say this is the best Mexican food I've ever had.  But, honestly, it satisfied my hunger and craving for some good Mexican food.  Plus, it's cheap.  It's also a couple blocks from where I live!  They serve beer and wine and have their own home made sangria, which I'd like to try next time.

The place isn't huge, but not bad if you want to stop by for a quick meal.  The vibe is pretty chill and the service staff was really friendly.

We'll be back!!!  'Just noticed they have a happy hour menu, and I definitely want to check it out!

excerpts: I got the spicy chicken burrito with spicy salsa
and it really was not at all spicy.
The chicken was also pretty flavorless and the burritos -- which sell for $6.95 -- don't even include cheese, lettuce or guacamole.
You're essentially paying "super" burrito prices for a really bland, boring burrito.
burrito.author: Angelo S.
burrito.review:
Really tasteless burritos. I got the spicy chicken burrito with spicy salsa and it really was not at all spicy. The chicken was also pretty flavorless and the burritos -- which sell for $6.95 -- don't even include cheese, lettuce or guacamole. You're essentially paying "super" burrito prices for a really bland, boring burrito.

The only reason that it gets 2 stars instead of 1 is the atmosphere and the chips. It was nice to sit there and eat. It's really big and open and once you order you get a number and wait for someone to bring you your food. The chips are also pretty tasty and crispy as far as your average taqueria chips go.

I probably won't go back there unless someone else offers to pay. These guys need to really step it up.

excerpts: During lunch, it takes them 10+ minutes to prepare a burrito order to-go.
If you want a fast lunch, Subway is across the street and cheaper.
burrito.author: Chad S.
burrito.review:
The food is just "okay," which makes the price a bit high. My main issue with Iron Cactus is the service is so slow.

During lunch, it takes them 10+ minutes to prepare a burrito order to-go. If you want a fast lunch, Subway is across the street and cheaper.

excerpts: Burrito bowl comes with no carnitas on top as ordered.
burrito.author: l c.
burrito.review:
If good intentions could make food get prepared correctly and taste good, I'd be a happy Iron Cactus customer.  Alas, that's just not the way the world works.  

As others have mentioned, they opened fairly recently, so I'm willing to give it another shot in a few months.  Here are the issues we encountered though:

1) The guy taking the order didn't seem to know the menu. I said, 1 veggie taco plate has 2 tacos right? He said, okay 2 veggie tacos. I said, no just 1 veggie taco plate. He said, okay 1 veggie taco. I said, no I want the plate, with 2 tacos. He did not say anything and wrote down veggie taco plate with a 2 next to it.  Hmm, okay, we'll figure that out later.  

2) The guy who takes the order writes it down in English, but the woman filling the order doesn't know English. He then translates it to Spanish for her. Sorry, but that kinda ruins the assembly-line concept. 

3) At the register, I clarify the taco situation. There's a guacamole situation too, but this is getting long-winded.  We go outside and wait for food.

4) The food takes awhile. 1 fish taco plate comes with 2 naked fish tacos and beans and rice on the side. The other fish taco plate comes with 2 fish tacos with guacamole & sour cream on top, and no beans and rice on the side. Burrito bowl comes with no carnitas on top as ordered.

5) Nice man comes and puts carnitas on top of bowl and comes out with another fish taco plate. This time it has sour cream & beans & rice.  

So, in summary, what you order may not be what you get, and it probably won't taste very good, but it will be served with a smile!

excerpts: I was craving a burrito
so I used my Yelp iPhone app to find a place close to my office.
Since I was craving a burrito I went for the Super Burrito, which comes with sour cream and guacamole.
While it was a big, tasty burrito it had two negatives.
One, it unwrapped
so I couldn't eat it like a burrito, but had to use a fork and knife.
Two, it was overpriced.
I think $9 is a little too much for some basic ingredients.
That said, I may venture back to try some of the combo plates or tacos, but I did pass a few other Mexican spots on my way back to the office that I may try out first.
burrito.author: Angela D.
burrito.review:
Now that I'm living in San Francisco, I've got lots of foodie exploring to do, both around my new office and my new home. I was craving a burrito so I used my Yelp iPhone app to find a place close to my office. And that's how I arrived at The Iron Cactus.

There is a large menu and it's a quick ordering process, so if you don't know what you want, I would recommend stepping back to review the menu first. Since I was craving a burrito I went for the Super Burrito, which comes with sour cream and guacamole. I had 3 types of chicken, 4 types of beans and 3 types of salsa to choose from, so be prepared to make some very important decisions.

While it was a big, tasty burrito it had two negatives. One, it unwrapped so I couldn't eat it like a burrito, but had to use a fork and knife. Two, it was overpriced. I think $9 is a little too much for some basic ingredients. That said, I may venture back to try some of the combo plates or tacos, but I did pass a few other Mexican spots on my way back to the office that I may try out first.

excerpts: All of the food looked great and my friend loved the burrito that he got.
Great space, friendly service, and the price was good for the neighborhood.
I think I am going to become a regular...
burrito.author: Dave O.
burrito.review:
I had walked by this place several times and it was always busy so went in today and got a great Mexican salad with grilled chicken. Huge portion, lots of chicken, and the roasted corn was delicious. 
I was surprised by the mixed reviews on here. All of the food looked great and my friend loved the burrito that he got. 
Great space, friendly service, and the price was good for the neighborhood. I think I am going to become a regular...

excerpts: Burrito - not terrible but the undercooked green peppers and onions were off putting.
burrito.author: Anton E.
burrito.review:
Nice space but the food and service need a lot of work.

Crispy Taco - not even kinda crispy.
Burrito - not terrible but the undercooked green peppers and onions were off putting.

FOH staff needs more training
Food needs help

excerpts: After a week since, I last ate my Super Steak Burrito at Taquería Guadalajara...
I came here with my cousin on a sunday to The Iron Cactus just to get a Super Steak Burrito to go and take it inside to the SF Giants game...
After eating it inside AT&T Park and before the San Francisco Giants take the field against the Boston Red Sox after when I was done with my Super Steak Burrito I have to say its okay
but I like more when I go to Mission District area and buy a Super Steak Burrito over there...
burrito.author: William B.
burrito.review: After a week since, I last ate my Super Steak Burrito at Taquería Guadalajara... I came here with my cousin on a sunday to The Iron Cactus just to get a Super Steak Burrito to go and take it inside to the SF Giants game... After eating it inside AT&T Park and before the San Francisco Giants take the field against the Boston Red Sox after when I was done with my Super Steak Burrito I have to say its okay but I like more when I go to Mission District area and buy a Super Steak Burrito over there...

excerpts: I ordered a regular carne asada burrito to-go.
Simple enough.
Can't go wrong with that, right?
I was the only person in line and it took about 10 minutes to make.
The tortilla was warm but the contents were cold.
Their rice had corn, peas and carrots, which is something I'm not used to, but it didn't really bother me.
It wasn't rolled evenly but the size was decent.
burrito.author: Zell C.
burrito.review:
Love the space... 

The food.. Not so much.

I ordered a regular carne asada burrito to-go. Simple enough. Can't go wrong with that, right? I was the only person in line and it took about 10 minutes to make. The tortilla was warm but the contents were cold. Their rice had corn, peas and carrots, which is something I'm not used to, but it didn't really bother me. It wasn't rolled evenly but the size was decent. It came with complimentary chips and pico de gallo (which were actually good). 

It's not bad, but it's far from being the best taqueria in the city. They recently opened so maybe I'll come back in a few months and hopefully I'll be able to update my review.

excerpts: Really good burrito and the green sauce is pretty good.
There will always be a line at lunch, but it's worth the wait.
I really liked the atmosphere too.
I can't wait to try something else there!
burrito.author: Nicole H.
burrito.review: Really good burrito and the green sauce is pretty good. There will always be a line at lunch, but it's worth the wait. I really liked the atmosphere too. I can't wait to try something else there!

excerpts: I ordered a typical carne asada burrito for comparison's sake: pinto beans, spicy, everything on/in it.
I doubt if I've ever paid so much for a burrito that lacked cheese and guacamole.
The flavors were one note, unfortunately that note was salty.
Overall a pretty unmemorable first time experience leaving Chavo's as this neighborhoods best burrito (which isn't exactly a compliment).
burrito.author: Kenny S.
burrito.review:
I ordered a typical carne asada burrito for comparison's sake: pinto beans, spicy, everything on/in it.

Seven-plus dollars later, I received a steamed tortilla filled mainly with rice, a smathering of pinto beans, a dash of salsa and a sprinkling of meat. Allegedly, there was also crema in there, but I found no evidence of it. I doubt if I've ever paid so much for a burrito that lacked cheese and guacamole. The flavors were one note, unfortunately that note was salty. I tasted, I added salsa and yet still I just tasted bland, salty flavors. 

Overall a pretty unmemorable first time experience leaving Chavo's as this neighborhoods best burrito (which isn't exactly a compliment).

excerpts:
I ordered a burrito just so that I could compare burritos to burritos, but Iron Cactus really needs to start working harder and pumping more "iron.
The atmosphere was nice and the servers there were nice too, but the food was just not up to par. 
Anyway, I had to drench my burrito in the not so fresh salsa because the burrito was a little dry and low in flavor.
burrito.author: Alex A.
burrito.review:
I ordered a burrito just so that I could compare burritos to burritos, but Iron Cactus really needs to start working harder and pumping more "iron." The atmosphere was nice and the servers there were nice too, but the food was just not up to par. 
I was shocked that my chips did not automatically come with salsa. So I asked one of the guys at the counter and he gave me a small container of salsa that didn't look very fresh. 
Anyway, I had to drench my burrito in the not so fresh salsa because the burrito was a little dry and low in flavor. 
Hopefully Iron C will make more improvements in the near future.

On a positive note, I did get some free gas =P

excerpts: As someone who is hyper-critical of Mexican food, the Iron Cactus ranks pretty high, and it is the ONLY place to get a good burrito in the neighborhood, period.
I've been going to Chavos since the mid-90's and will never step foot in the place again, now that Iron Cactus has opened.
That's 2-3 meals a week,
Still, paying 9+ dollars for a burrito is painful.
burrito.author: Matthew W.
burrito.review:
I have to say I am astonished by the number of low ratings on this place.  As someone who is hyper-critical of Mexican food, the Iron Cactus ranks pretty high, and it is the ONLY place to get a good burrito in the neighborhood, period.  I've been going to Chavos since the mid-90's and will never step foot in the place again, now that Iron Cactus has opened. That's 2-3 meals a week, if not more!


- FLAVOR: I do agree with a number of reviews that the food could be a bit more flavorful or spicy, but give them more than the two months they've been open and the flavors will grow better.  If you think restaurants are all perfect they day they open, then you've been living in TV-land. 

- PRICE: Compared to taquerias like Pancho Villa, the prices are high.  When you throw in the fact that the vegetables are all organic, it only makes sense that the prices are higher.  Still, paying 9+ dollars for a burrito is painful.  

- SERVICE: Amazing.  The employees are always smiling and saying hello.  After two times there they remembered me.  That makes a huge difference.  I noticed some posts about how confusing the layout of the place is, but it seemed pretty simple to me.  Also, the place has been open for all of two months, so the owners are there, and sometimes take an order or two.  The employees, including the cooks (and "chef") are virtually all from latin america, in case this makes a difference, and I think it does, on some level of perceived "authenticity".

excerpts: - The burrito is cold.
There's no way around this.

Could at least mix a chili or something in when cooking

- The chips in the bag are decent, but no salsa thrown in and no visible salsa bar

- A little on the small side, so that the (cold and taste-free) meat doesn't mix with the other ingredients in the burrito.
Uhh, I want cheese on the burrito"
It's extra"
Yes, I get that.

I want cheese"

Because of the location and the $8.27 you charge for a small burrito with cheese, your restaurant might do well, but don't delude yourself into thinking that you're doing a good job with the food because of it.
burrito.author: A K.
burrito.review:
Sigh. To go order. Really wanted to like this place as it's down the street from my apartment but it's just not good.

- The burrito is cold. There's no way around this. The tortilla stays cold and somewhat wet (wrapped in two layers of foil) while eating

- The carnitas has no flavor at all. Could at least mix a chili or something in when cooking

- The chips in the bag are decent, but no salsa thrown in and no visible salsa bar

- A little on the small side, so that the (cold and taste-free) meat doesn't mix with the other ingredients in the burrito. There is a high meat:other things ratio

- Maybe hire someone who's worked at Chipotle or Taco Bell to avoid having conversations like this with your customers: "I'd like cheese and sour cream"  "Cheese is extra"  "OK"  "So you want extra cheese?"  "Uhh, I want cheese on the burrito"  "It's extra"  "Yes, I get that. I want cheese"

Because of the location and the $8.27 you charge for a small burrito with cheese, your restaurant might do well, but don't delude yourself into thinking that you're doing a good job with the food because of it.

excerpts: I would rather suggest go to victor burrito which is just 2 blocks away from this place.
Far better quality.
burrito.author: Malhar T.
burrito.review: I would rather suggest go to victor burrito which is just 2 blocks away from this place. Far better quality.

excerpts: Awesome Burrito Bowls, definitely worth the price.
I was doing a job training neaer here, and after the first day I was hooked.
Had lunch  there every day.
Oh and very fast.
If only they servced hot tortilla chips, and gave you more chips
burrito.author: Tatiana T.
burrito.review: Awesome Burrito Bowls, definitely worth the price.  I was doing a job training neaer here, and after the first day I was hooked.  Had lunch  there every day.  Oh and very fast.  If only they servced hot tortilla chips, and gave you more chips

excerpts: And a baby burrito, which was fairly big and that was bland too.
And the guy taking our order didn't look like he wanted to be somewhere else.
burrito.author: miss k.
burrito.review: Food was eh, and bland. I'll stick to me El Farolito thank you very much. I got the tortilla soup, which was just tomato soup with some veggies and chicken thrown in. Bland. And a baby burrito, which was fairly big and that was bland too. And the guy taking our order didn't look like he wanted to be somewhere else.

excerpts: Ordered a super Al Pastor (dry and tasteless) burrito.
The super burrito came with super disappointment.
Who puts pineapple in a burrito without listing the ingredient on the menu?
This wasn't a piece of pineapple, it was more like half a pineapple.
Properly cut and placed throughout the burrito.
$9.48 for a super bland burrito is not inexpensive.
burrito.author: Peruvian E.
burrito.review:
You need an iron stomach to eat at The Iron Cactus!

First visit. Ordered a super Al Pastor (dry and tasteless) burrito. The super burrito came with super disappointment. Who puts pineapple in a burrito without listing the ingredient on the menu? This wasn't a piece of pineapple, it was more like half a pineapple. Properly cut and placed throughout the burrito.

Yelp has this place listed with one dollar sign indicating it is a inexpensive restaurant. $9.48 for a super bland burrito is not inexpensive. WTF.

I'll give The Iron Cactus another shot but my first impression is disappointing.

excerpts: Went there for lunch today and got a spicy beef burrito.
I'm not usually a fan of rice w/veggies in my burritos but this one wasn't too bad.
Overall it was tasty but missing that nice grilled beef flavor.
burrito.author: Simon S.
burrito.review:
Not a bad place. Went there for lunch today and got a spicy beef burrito. I'm not usually a fan of rice w/veggies in my burritos but this one wasn't too bad. Overall it was tasty but missing that nice grilled beef flavor. I did appreciate the heat which at the bottom of it was actually too spicy.

I'll be back.

excerpts: Two of us each got a burrito to go:
Chicken for one, Carnitas for the other.
Dining companion said the chicken burrito was good.
The carnitas was good, but not outstanding.
Each burrito comes with Meat, Rice, Beans, Sour Cream (can't remember if it came with cheese or not).
Convenient, close to Cal Train, and in an area that doesn't have much in the way of "take it to go" burrito places.
burrito.author: Jason I.
burrito.review:
So if I don't have time to go all the way from the Cal Train station to the Mission and want a quick "fix" - I'd come back again.

Two of us each got a burrito to go:  Chicken for one, Carnitas for the other.  Dining companion said the chicken burrito was good.  The carnitas was good, but not outstanding.  Had a couple of really hard, overcooked pieces of meat in mine that I couldn't eat - but the flavor was good.

Each burrito comes with Meat, Rice, Beans, Sour Cream (can't remember if it came with cheese or not).  You can order yours spicy or mild, and they put the salsa on the side.  Since ours was to go, I asked if they had a salsa bar - and they don't.  There are two types of salsa on each table, so I was given a container to fill up the salsa.

As I read in some reviews, beware of the spicyness of the salsa.  I can handle "hot", but the green salsa on the table that I tasted was more like "fire".  So hot, that you almost couldn't enjoy it.  I know, I am a gringo - but I can handle spicy food - but this was way over the top.  The red sauce on the table I brought home was good.

I am also a "chip" guy, and the chips they sent home with us were great.  Lacking in salt, so I just added my own.  Convenient, close to Cal Train, and in an area that doesn't have much in the way of "take it to go" burrito places.  I'll go back, but will stay far away from the green over-the-top-spicy-make-me-sweat-a-little-salsa.

excerpts: I've gotten a burrito, no drink, here a couple of times and it's $11 or $12!
And not THAT good.
Apparently they have good deals like happy hour drinks and $1 taco night, but aside from that I try to avoid going there because of the prices.
Food is ok, nothing outstanding.
Service is ok, nothing outstanding.
It's nice that they have an outdoor patio and TVs airing sports, but you're paying for the ambiance.
burrito.author: Allison M.
burrito.review: I think this place is expensive for mexican food! I've gotten a burrito, no drink, here a couple of times and it's $11 or $12! And not THAT good. Apparently they have good deals like happy hour drinks and $1 taco night, but aside from that I try to avoid going there because of the prices. Food is ok, nothing outstanding. Service is ok, nothing outstanding. It's nice that they have an outdoor patio and TVs airing sports, but you're paying for the ambiance.

excerpts: I'm very hungry, however, only one Super Burrito was totally full....
that's really big....thanks.
burrito.author: Chifeng Q.
burrito.review: I'm very hungry, however, only one Super Burrito was totally full....that's really big....thanks.

excerpts: If I am very hungry I go with the Burrito bowl which is only $6.00.
Their Melon or Cantelop Frescas are fantastic on a sunny day.
~This is a popular spot as it is attached to the Creamery which is a very popular crepe house/cafe.

Come early and leave satisfied!
~Our office at Dolby has started to use them for catered events!
burrito.author: Patrick F.
burrito.review:
Great Mexican food period! I go here everyday for lunch and get one of their many salads if you want something light instead of a burger or sandwich. I recommend the Cactus Combination Salad if you like shrimp, steak and chicken all in one go.Nothing like paying $8.00 for a $12.00 salad They don't spare the avocados either. If I am very hungry I go with the Burrito bowl which is only $6.00. Their Melon or Cantelop Frescas are fantastic on a sunny day.
~This is a popular spot as it is attached to the Creamery which is a very popular crepe house/cafe. Come early and leave satisfied!
~Our office at Dolby has started to use them for catered events!

excerpts: I normally get a carne asada super burrito
but today I tried the BBQ Pork.
The first trip here the food was OK, did have a bite that was nothing but fat
but that's not the first time I've had a burrito and this has happened.
My second trip the food was perfect.
Today though will be the last trip here.
After deciding to try something other than carne asada I get back to my office to find I was given the wrong beans in my burrito.
After taking two bites in I chewed into a small piece of fat.
I looked down into the burrito and confirmed there was fat there.
I grabbed a fork and reached in to pull what I thought would be a small piece of fat.
Instead I end up removing (in one chunk)
a piece that was literally
3" x 3" of fat and unidentifiable pig parts.
I tried not to get too grossed out as I realized I could see part of a vein or organ.
I quietly hid it behind my plate and boldly pressed on as I'm starving.
After a few more bites I realized I just couldn't do it.
Not only was the BBQ Pork lacking in flavor
I just couldn't keep playing a guessing game of what would I come across next.
I'll get my burrito's from the roach coach from now on.
burrito.author: Jesse P.
burrito.review:
Today was my 3rd trip here. I normally get a carne asada super burrito but today I tried the BBQ Pork. The first trip here the food was OK, did have a bite that was nothing but fat but that's not the first time I've had a burrito and this has happened. My second trip the food was perfect. Today though will be the last trip here. After deciding to try something other than carne asada I get back to my office to find I was given the wrong beans in my burrito. After taking two bites in I chewed into a small piece of fat. I looked down into the burrito and confirmed there was fat there. I grabbed a fork and reached in to pull what I thought would be a small piece of fat. Instead I end up removing (in one chunk) a piece that was literally 3" x 3" of fat and unidentifiable pig parts. I tried not to get too grossed out as I realized I could see part of a vein or organ. I quietly hid it behind my plate and boldly pressed on as I'm starving. After a few more bites I realized I just couldn't do it. Not only was the BBQ Pork lacking in flavor I just couldn't keep playing a guessing game of what would I come across next. I dug through a few times with a fork trying to find actual meat but there didn't appear to be any.

Very sad and disappointed by this trip. It's one of the few places in walking distance but I'll never go here again. I'll get my burrito's from the roach coach from now on.

excerpts: Anyways..the only thing I ever get is the Super burrito bowl.
I phone in my order and by the time I get there (around 10 mins)
..it is ready.
Show my badge and I get a discount.
HOLLA.
The Burrito bowl comes with chips.
They have some spicy sauce in a bottle by the counter.
The Burrito bowl comes with chips.
They have some spicy sauce in a bottle by the counter.
I grab that and give my burrito bowl a quick splash.
I grab that and give my burrito bowl a quick splash.
I don't recommend eating the burrito bowl to often as it is pretty heavy/filling.
I don't recommend eating the burrito bowl to often as it is pretty heavy/filling.
burrito.author: Christopher L.
burrito.review: I come here about once or twice a month. This is the closest and most legit Mexican food in the area. It's about 2 short blocks away from China Basin. There is another place down the block however it is pretty crappy. Ill write a review for that place when I have time. It is going to be full of lulz.  Anyways..the only thing I ever get is the Super burrito bowl. I phone in my order and by the time I get there (around 10 mins)..it is ready. Show my badge and I get a discount. HOLLA. The Burrito bowl comes with chips. They have some spicy sauce in a bottle by the counter. I grab that and give my burrito bowl a quick splash. I don't recommend eating the burrito bowl to often as it is pretty heavy/filling.

excerpts:
I hoped the sauce would be good)
5) lettuce in my burrito event though it wasn't listed as a potential ingredient (so I didn't know to request that it be left out)
burrito.author: Corinne R.
burrito.review:
I was overjoyed with excitement at a new place to eat near my apartment. But, alas, it was not all I hoped it would be. Because the food was edible and I might go back when hungry in the future, it gets 3 stars.

Pros:
1) fresh crispy chips - best part of the meal
2) spicy salsa
3) tasty refried beans and rice
4) they gave us a basket of chips and salsa even though we didn't order it
5) Horchata and the reddish brown drink (don't know the name) were very tasty and not too sweet

Cons:
1) the person who took our order was barely paying attention and kept interrupting to giggle about something that was going on in the back
2) disorganized service. we weren't given a receipt and they didn't put our drink orders on our meal statement so when our food was brought out they didn't even know we'd ordered drinks.
3) Under-seasoned carnitas
4) Bland tofu (I know I was stupid to try - but I hoped the sauce would be good)
5) lettuce in my burrito event though it wasn't listed as a potential ingredient (so I didn't know to request that it be left out)

excerpts: To be fully honest, I only had a bite of my buddy's burrito which he claimed was pretty bland.
He ordered it spicy - and it had literally no spice.
burrito.author: Anish S.
burrito.review:
Hung out in the back patio here today reading a book. They basically get the two stars for nice outdoor seating and convenient location. I'd recommend it for relaxing.

To be fully honest, I only had a bite of my buddy's burrito which he claimed was pretty bland. He ordered it spicy - and it had literally no spice. The two kinds of salsa they offered were very boring as well.

You could tell by the clientele that they really aren't succeeding, or trying, to make exciting food. The crowd was all white and older - the kind you'd find talking about how they like Chipotle. (Sorry, I'm not very PC over here)

The prices are way too high for the low quality as well.

For those in the area looking for flavorful Mexican food, go to Chavo's (4th and Bryant) or Maya (2nd and Harrison). Both awesome places.

excerpts: I had the spicy chicken burrito.
I wouldn't put it in my top San Francisco burritos but it was a heck of a lot better than the other burritos I've had around SOMA.
burrito.author: Garrett D.
burrito.review:
We went here for dinner the other night.  Overall I was pretty happy.  This place is a good addition to the neighborhood.  SOMA was in need of a decent taqueria.  

I had the spicy chicken burrito.  I wouldn't put it in my top San Francisco burritos but it was a heck of a lot better than the other burritos I've had around SOMA.  The chicken wasn't very spicy but the salsa sure was.  The chips were light and tasty.  They also have a few beers on tap and good prices on pitchers.

This place has the potential to be great.  I hope the owners read some of the feedback and work on the food a bit.

excerpts: I ordered the burrito bowl, something I'm a big fan of.
Theirs didn't turn out so well as they used finely shredded lettuce that just ended up being a soupy mess at the bottom.
I will definitely be back to find out what their burritos are like.
burrito.author: D. D.
burrito.review:
I'm giving Iron Cactus 5 stars for their customer service! Good customer service is hard to find these days and I was pleasantly surprised to have been treated so well at the Iron Cactus. 

It was lunch rush hour and their credit card machine was down. They did their best and tried to save everyone time by just taking card numbers down. When I had a problem with the charge the next day, they fixed everything no questions asked. 

As for the food, it was ok. I ordered the burrito bowl, something I'm a big fan of. Theirs didn't turn out so well as they used finely shredded lettuce that just ended up being a soupy mess at the bottom. I will definitely be back to find out what their burritos are like. I think I just ordered the wrong thing. 

The management at this place still gets 5 big ones from me!!!!! Thank you!

excerpts: This is a one of the best burrito eateries in town and the owners are extremely friendly.
Fantastico.
burrito.author: S. N.
burrito.review: This is a one of the best burrito eateries in town and the owners are extremely friendly. Fantastico.

excerpts:
Got a carnitas burrito after my friday caltrain commute home

Reasonable price.
Good solid burrito
burrito.author: Paul Y.
burrito.review:
Got a carnitas burrito after my friday caltrain commute home

Reasonable price.
Good solid burrito
Ooober close to caltrain
Friendly staff

Works for me.

I didn't eat in, but the place seemed spacious and comfortable.

excerpts: Had to go with the basics and tried the carnitas burrito.
I was advised that it is sold as a wet burrito with my choice of three sauces.
I opted for the green.
The burrito had the largest chunks of pork I've ever seen in a taqueria.
The green sauce that bathed the entire burrito was soooo yummy.
burrito.author: Green Devil W.
burrito.review:
Wasn't it Chevy's who coined the phrase no "smashed beans and rice?"
Well the Mission Bay now has an amazing option for "Gringo-ized" Mexican fare. But really this food could fit in with the best of the Mission district. 

The interior is bare wood and the menu is written on a chalkboard. The menu expands beyond just burritos and tacos and hopes to appease all types of people (read: you can even get tofu). They have many beers on tap and even serve wine!

Had to go with the basics and tried the carnitas burrito. I was advised that it is sold as a wet burrito with my choice of three sauces. I opted for the green. Wife ordered the tortilla soup. 

The hearty and healthy soup arrived to the table first (rather lukewarm) with a side plate of additional garnish including: corn, tortilla strips, queso fresco and fresh tomatoes. It could of used more of a kick but that is just personal preference and the table had two delicious salsas to add. The burrito had the largest chunks of pork I've ever seen in a taqueria. The green sauce that bathed the entire burrito was soooo yummy.

I used to hit Subway at the Caltrain station prior to heading down the peninsula but now I have a new vice!!!

excerpts: I ordered the Al Pastor Burrito with Rice and Guac
and I ended up with a severe case of food poisoning.
About two hours after I finished the burrito, I started getting intense headaches and stomach aches.
I tried to sleep it off to no prevail.
With in an hour, I broke out in a sweat, followed by a bad case of diarrhea.
I ended up throwing up all night.
Today, I feel terribly week and dehydrated.
Needless to say, I am not rating this place very highly.
Avoid the Iron Cactus at all costs.
If you have to go there, stay away from the Al Pastor!
burrito.author: Oliver S.
burrito.review: I went their for the first time last night because it's near my loft in SOMA.  I ordered the Al Pastor Burrito with Rice and Guac and I ended up with a severe case of food poisoning.  About two hours after I finished the burrito, I started getting intense headaches and stomach aches.  I tried to sleep it off to no prevail.  With in an hour, I broke out in a sweat, followed by a bad case of diarrhea.  I ended up throwing up all night.  Today, I feel terribly week and dehydrated.  Needless to say, I am not rating this place very highly.  Avoid the Iron Cactus at all costs.  If you have to go there, stay away from the Al Pastor!

excerpts: My burrito was mediocre but my hubby's enchiladas were actually HEATED IN A MICROWAVE!!!!
burrito.author: christy p.
burrito.review:
My burrito was mediocre but my hubby's enchiladas were actually HEATED IN A MICROWAVE!!!! 

On top of that, the staff were milling around, not staying on top of orders, and after we waited 20 minutes for our food to be heated in a microwave, they just let our food sit on the counter instead of taking the extra step and actually giving it to us.

Never again will we go to Iron Cactus!  I'd rather go to Dos Pinas any day -Dos Pinas has amazing food and competent staff, even if there's a little wait.

excerpts: I've been there 4 times, and every time it's extremely overpriced ($1.50 to add jalapenos to a $10 burrito is ridiculous!), and twice they've messed up my order.
burrito.author: Dawn M.
burrito.review:
I keep hoping this neighborhood Mexican restaurant will stop disappointing, but it just doesn't.  I've been there 4 times, and every time it's extremely overpriced ($1.50 to add jalapenos to a $10 burrito is ridiculous!), and twice they've messed up my order.  How hard is it to get a whole wheat tortilla with pinto beans?  

It's overpriced, the service is bad, they mess up, and the only thing that kept me going back was the proximity to my house.  It's just not worth it though.  Too bad, because it has a lot of potential.

excerpts: I'm a vegan and my husband ordered me a spinach tortilla burrito with tofu and they sent it home with chicken in it.
burrito.author: J S.
burrito.review:
Worst Mexican in San Francisco. 

Con:  high prices, rude services, bad tasting food, they send you home with the wrong order


I'm a vegan and my husband ordered me a spinach tortilla burrito with tofu and they sent it home with chicken in it. I didn't find out until I took a bite out of it. 

Another time I asked for a spinach tortilla and they sent me home with flour. 

Another time I asked if they had fresh chips that were warm and they said no and pointed me to the stacks of bagged chips that had been sitting around for hours. They have an area where they warm chips under a light, but it looks as if the staff got lazy and pre-bagged chips which over time got cold and stale. 

The burritos are very expensive and need tablespoons full of salsa to have taste.

excerpts: I had the margarita on the rocks with a wet steak burrito.
Boyfriend had a shrimp plate that came with rice and beans and of course tortillas.
He had a beer to wash it all down...
Not too bad for the price...
It was just OK though..
Margarita was nice and strong =)
burrito.author: Charlene D.
burrito.review: Came here for a quick lunch and drink before the Giants game.  I had the margarita on the rocks with a wet steak burrito.  Boyfriend had a shrimp plate that came with rice and beans and of course tortillas. He had a beer to wash it all down... Not too bad for the price...It was just OK though..Margarita was nice and strong =)

excerpts: My only complaint is the charges for extras - like sour cream, $1 for some chips (if i buy a burrito or 2 tacos, throwing a handful of chips in the bag isn't gonna kill you).
burrito.author: Jonathan P.
burrito.review:
I love it. You're not going to get super authentic mexican food here but its still delicious. They also have a good selection of beers on tap. 

M-F from 3-6PM is happy hour with $3 beers and $2 tacos. I work down the street and stop in almost every day to get 2 tacos to go. They are always big and tasty. 

My only complaint is the charges for extras - like sour cream, $1 for some chips (if i buy a burrito or 2 tacos, throwing a handful of chips in the bag isn't gonna kill you). Still, gotta do what they gotta do. 

I like the guac, but I've definitely had better. I can't tell if it comes prepackaged or not. It tastes/looks a lot like Calvo guac you buy in the supermarket - I like chunky guac. 

But no doubt, you will get a damn fine soft taco for $2 during happy hour. When the weather is better, I'll be hanging out in their "beer garden" and bringing some tacos into the ball park.

excerpts: I've tried the taco salad and the mini burrito with spicy chicken.
burrito.author: Katherine F.
burrito.review:
Go back. Try it again. This place improved it's food drastically from last week. My company tested their food initially and came back at them with updates and they improved tremendously. The hot sauce has that kick, the food is fresher, the ambiance is awesome, the servers are nice, and the owners are the coolest. 

I've tried the taco salad and the mini burrito with spicy chicken.

excerpts: So I ordered a baby-burrito this time of carnitas-yuck!
I threw it away after I ate half of it(its not very big)
it tasted smoky and carnitas shouldn't taste like pulled pork it should have a rich pork flavor.
The black beans were dry and not that great in taste.
burrito.author: E N.
burrito.review: This place is OK..and I like plain food so I was very surprised at how 'not good' the food was.  I got the taco salad and it was plain and dry.. I thought ok I got a salad at a Mexican food place let me give it another try.  So I ordered a baby-burrito this time of carnitas-yuck! I threw it away after I ate half of it(its not very big) it tasted smoky and carnitas shouldn't taste like pulled pork it should have a rich pork flavor.  The black beans were dry and not that great in taste.  The only thing I really liked about this place is the guacamole and salsa they have out! Which is almost unheard of-to have all you can eat guacamole.  I dont hate it here and if I HAD to eat here again I would not get pork or black beans.. so you can be your own judge.  I gave this place 2 stars and not 1 because the service was really GREAT and the decor was relaxing and clean.

excerpts: Until today....not knowing what to eat and being cooped up indoors all morning, decided to walk over and get a burrito for lunch, and get some work done while sitting outside.
Well, not only did i end up paying over 8 bucks for a bean, cheese, rice burrito, but it came out wrong.
My burrito had CHICKEN!!!
I noticed 1/4 of the way through.
Now, for anyone who is a veggie (like me for my whole life) this was a traumatic experience.
I took it back and explained to the person my issue.
He chuckled at my anger, and then I saw when he went to kitchen, the ladies behind the counter were LAUGHING!
So, I spent 8 bucks, panicked about eating chicken, got upset and laughed at...
I'm done with this place...
burrito.author: Sheetal P.
burrito.review: I have been giving this place the benefit of the doubt.  It is not the best, but it is also not the worst mex food.  Given it is like 5 steps from my front door, I have been ok with it.  It is decent, a little pricey but given the other Mexican joints in the hood close at 3 pm, this is been a good option.  Until today....not knowing what to eat and being cooped up indoors all morning, decided to walk over and get a burrito for lunch, and get some work done while sitting outside. Well, not only did i end up paying over 8 bucks for a bean, cheese, rice burrito, but it came out wrong.  My burrito had CHICKEN!!!  I noticed 1/4 of the way through.  Now, for anyone who is a veggie (like me for my whole life) this was a traumatic experience.  I took it back and explained to the person my issue.  He chuckled at my anger, and then I saw when he went to kitchen, the ladies behind the counter were LAUGHING!  So, I spent 8 bucks, panicked about eating chicken, got upset and laughed at...I'm done with this place...

excerpts: At the time we were living about a block away and the idea of a burrito joint open in the evenings excited me to say the least (lazy not wanting to go 10 min into the Mission, I know).
But the food quality is flat out disappointing.
It was like cafeteria quality, sitting in buffet warmers.
The flavors were flat, the service was like a fast food joint and the whole experience just seems off.
it's a nice place insight, could be a really cool hang out to get tacos and beers, but just missed the mark with the food.
burrito.author: Darin A.
burrito.review: It was a sad day the first time we ate here. At the time we were living about a block away and the idea of a burrito joint open in the evenings excited me to say the least (lazy not wanting to go 10 min into the Mission, I know). But the food quality is flat out disappointing. It was like cafeteria quality, sitting in buffet warmers. The flavors were flat, the service was like a fast food joint and the whole experience just seems off. it's a nice place insight, could be a really cool hang out to get tacos and beers, but just missed the mark with the food.

excerpts: Like: being able to order at the counter and completely customize what I do and don't want on my nachos or burrito bowl.
burrito.author: Macy M.
burrito.review:
Love: $3.00 3pm-6pm ( 7-day a week) draft Happy Hour and a heated dog-friendy patio AND tofu as a 'meat' option. 

Like: being able to order at the counter and completely customize what I do and don't want on my nachos or burrito bowl.  Also like the food prices overall and nice staff.

Not So Much: The food lacks flavor ( you don't crave it next week) and seems overcooked, kinda soft. Chipolte is going to charge you more for beers, but give a more flavorful experience you want to go back to.

excerpts: We really enjoy heading here before a giants game for a burrito and a couple of beers.
They have a great outdoor patio with a TV too, which provides a great spot to enjoy the weather and a ball game.
burrito.author: Nick V.
burrito.review: Its really a shame that the service is so ridiculously bad, because the food is fantastic and authentic.  We really enjoy heading here before a giants game for a burrito and a couple of beers.  They have a great outdoor patio with a TV too, which provides a great spot to enjoy the weather and a ball game.  So great food, great atmosphere, bad service, chintzy chips and salsa baskets.

excerpts: their lack of organization and consistency on more than one occasion has lead to 20 minute waits for a f***ing burrito.
And on top of that on at least one of those occasions they got the burrito absolutely wrong, the lady ordered no beans por favor.
I used to hop between this place and Mexico Au Parc, but now I'm sticking to Au Parc.
burrito.author: Michael A.
burrito.review: The food and decor are A-OK, but  their lack of organization and consistency on more than one occasion has lead to 20 minute waits for a f***ing burrito. And on top of that on at least one of those occasions they got the burrito absolutely wrong, the lady ordered no beans por favor. I used to hop between this place and Mexico Au Parc, but now I'm sticking to Au Parc.

excerpts: Don't get the super burritos as there's nothing super about them, just extra cheese and sour cream added to a normal sized burrito.
I also had the super nachos and
the serving size actually lived up to the name but the taste was nothing special; beans, meat, cheese, sour cream, and guacamole piled on tortilla chips.
Maybe my review will go up after I come back and try the happy hour from 6p-9p for 1 dollar tacos and 2 dollar beers.
burrito.author: Angelo T.
burrito.review: Don't get the super burritos as there's nothing super about them, just extra cheese and sour cream added to a normal sized burrito. I also had the super nachos and the serving size actually lived up to the name but the taste was nothing special; beans, meat, cheese, sour cream, and guacamole piled on tortilla chips. Maybe my review will go up after I come back and try the happy hour from 6p-9p for 1 dollar tacos and 2 dollar beers.

excerpts: Glad to have found a burrito joint near work for lunch!
Had the burrito bowl, which is basically a salad, spicy which had fresh chopped jalepenos, yum.
Love the free chips, yea.
burrito.author: Jessica G.
burrito.review: Glad to have found a burrito joint near work for lunch! Had the burrito bowl, which is basically a salad, spicy which had fresh chopped jalepenos, yum. Love the free chips, yea.

excerpts: I had the chicken burrito wet which had this really nice chargrilled taste.
It was happy hour
so drinks were like $3.
It was empty at first but business picked up quickly.
I think I liked this place cuz it wasn't Chipotle.
Didn't like the flies, but I think its because they leave the door open :/
burrito.author: Shardie' T.
burrito.review: Quick, good, & hot. I had the chicken burrito wet which had this really nice chargrilled taste. It was happy hour so drinks were like $3. It was empty at first but business picked up quickly. I think I liked this place cuz it wasn't Chipotle. Didn't like the flies, but I think its because they leave the door open :/

excerpts: If I order a Burrito bowl, I get a burrito.
If I order cheese enchiladas I get chicken enchiladas.
And today I order a simple tostada; the menu says it comes with rice, no rice to be found.
I likely won't eat here again even though it's pretty good Mexican food because it drives me crazy that my order it always wrong!
It is always a bit loud in there, maybe that's why?
The staff is having a hard time hearing the orders?
I don't know....
burrito.author: Sarah B.
burrito.review: This place always always screws up my order.  The food would get a strong 4 stars if they could just get my order right.  9 times out of 10 it's wrong.  And I'm not that complicated.  If I order a Burrito bowl, I get a burrito. If I order cheese enchiladas I get chicken enchiladas.  And today I order a simple tostada; the menu says it comes with rice, no rice to be found.  I likely won't eat here again even though it's pretty good Mexican food because it drives me crazy that my order it always wrong! It is always a bit loud in there, maybe that's why?  The staff is having a hard time hearing the orders?  I don't know....

excerpts: I had a chicken burrito with everything in it.
It was really good, had flavor and was lighter than a typical burrito
--I didn't get that sicky feel (probably because it came sans the lard and grease).
The service was good too.
If I wanted real good and greasy mexican food, I would take BART to Taqueria CanCun on Mission btwn 18/19th.
burrito.author: Alexandra O.
burrito.review:
I really don't think people understand that Iron Cactus is not going to be your greasy Mission taqueria that's going to be dirt cheap with god-knows-what meat fatty goodness in your tacos and burritos. 

This is a Mexican place in SOMA next to Cal-train and Safeway for christ sake! What's wrong with you people? It's expensive because it is a mexican yuppie taqueria for all of us granola people that uses organic ingredients, no hormone meat and white chicken meat. 

I had a chicken burrito with everything in it. It was really good, had flavor and was lighter than a typical burrito--I didn't get that sicky feel (probably because it came sans the lard and grease). The service was good too.  If I wanted real good and greasy mexican food, I would take BART to Taqueria CanCun on Mission btwn 18/19th.

excerpts:
See point (2) to understand how that might be possible.
2) Organize your ingredient in the order a burrito is made.
Notice in most restaurants, they put the cheese and the burrito first, and then the fixin's in order.
That way, people can move down the line single file.
3) Eliminate the slips order tickets.
No one needs to write down an order like "burrito on whole wheat with chicken and cheese.
"  Write the type of burrito on the foil with an indelible pen or stick a colored toothpick into the finished burrito.
Note that (2) facilitates this.
4) Stop bringing burritos to the table.
Not only will you no longer need to employ the cute spiky-blond-haired runner to bring the burrito to my table, but you'll have customers who sit down with food.

Note that (3) is prerequisite for this.
5) Get rid of both of those dreadful salsas you have at the table.
The green one is too hot to have any taste and
When you make a burrito with cheese, put it in a steamer to melt the cheese onto the burrito.
No one likes hard, cold cheese in the middle of their burrito.
Chips should not be extra: the cost of throwing a few chips onto someone's plate is minimal.

(See (9) for clarification)
9)
Source your chips from a quality chip manufacturer.
Yours tasted like a step above Doritos.
10) Take The Card (i.e., American Express).
Don't give me the crap about their fees: it's a cost of doing business.
11) Put some flavor and spice into your food.
None of the food was "bad," but newspaper has more flavor.
Cilantro, chilis, peppers, pepper, salt, lime, etc. . .
try 'em out.
burrito.author: Mark J.
burrito.review:
Never let white people run a burritoria.  Most of the scathing remarks I wanted to make were made in other reviews, I'm going to give The Iron Cactus some free consulting:

1) Move people through line single file.  See point (2) to understand how that might be possible.
2) Organize your ingredient in the order a burrito is made.  Notice in most restaurants, they put the cheese and the burrito first, and then the fixin's in order.  That way, people can move down the line single file.
3) Eliminate the slips order tickets.  No one needs to write down an order like "burrito on whole wheat with chicken and cheese."  Write the type of burrito on the foil with an indelible pen or stick a colored toothpick into the finished burrito.  Note that (2) facilitates this.
4) Stop bringing burritos to the table.  Not only will you no longer need to employ the cute spiky-blond-haired runner to bring the burrito to my table, but you'll have customers who sit down with food.  Note that (3) is prerequisite for this.
5) Get rid of both of those dreadful salsas you have at the table.  The green one is too hot to have any taste and I've never tasted a more watery, bland roasted tomato salsa. See (11).
6) Put less rice into your burritos.  It's starchy, bland filler.  See (11) again.  Actually, go directly to (11) right now and memorize it as a mantra.
7) When you make a burrito with cheese, put it in a steamer to melt the cheese onto the burrito.  No one likes hard, cold cheese in the middle of their burrito.
8) Chips should not be extra: the cost of throwing a few chips onto someone's plate is minimal. (See (9) for clarification)
9) Source your chips from a quality chip manufacturer.  Yours tasted like a step above Doritos.
10) Take The Card (i.e., American Express).  Don't give me the crap about their fees: it's a cost of doing business.
11) Put some flavor and spice into your food.  None of the food was "bad," but newspaper has more flavor. Cilantro, chilis, peppers, pepper, salt, lime, etc. . . try 'em out.
12) "Super" option, please! 

(bonus) 13) Visit a joint like Mexico au Parc or Victor's with a notebook and copy down exactly what they do.

excerpts: I really liked the burrito I ordered and my kids loved their quesadillas.
It was a great meal to eat before going to the game and eating overpriced hot dogs.
A friend recommended this place to me
and I'm really glad he did.
It is walking distance to the ballpark which is really convenient in case you are on your way to a show or a game...
I like to go there after a game because I would rather sit in a friendly restaurant then fight the 30min traffic jam leaving the ballpark.
Definitely worth a trip over there if you have time.
burrito.author: Aurelie C.
burrito.review: OK, so first I have to start off by saying that for the longest time, I simply always went in this place to use their restrooms with my kids before going to a game, or to see cirque du soleil or whatever.  The staff never gave me dirty looks, and was always polite in allowing me to use the restroom, which you would think they would get horribly annoyed with as I'm sure I wasn't the only one to do this.  So finally I thought it would only be fair if I actually sat and ate at this very friendly welcoming place with clean restrooms.  I really liked the burrito I ordered and my kids loved their quesadillas.  It was a great meal to eat before going to the game and eating overpriced hot dogs.  A friend recommended this place to me and I'm really glad he did.  It is walking distance to the ballpark which is really convenient in case you are on your way to a show or a game... I like to go there after a game because I would rather sit in a friendly restaurant then fight the 30min traffic jam leaving the ballpark.  Definitely worth a trip over there if you have time.

excerpts: I'm still trying to find good Mexican food within walking distance to my work, but this satisfies your craving for a burrito.
It's just not the best burrito ever.
burrito.author: Klevin D.
burrito.review: I'm still trying to find good Mexican food within walking distance to my work, but this satisfies your craving for a burrito. It's just not the best burrito ever. The salsa verde is pretty good.

excerpts: The burritos from what I could see resembled overstuffed dish towels, basically the usual-size burrito that you see everywhere, that most people snarf down in one sitting but would take me a week to eat.
burrito.author: Candace W.
burrito.review:
Here's the deal:

Mexican food as we Americans know isn't true Mexican---it's strictly watered down for the Gringos.  True Mexican food is very complex, yet at the same time very simple and clear.

That said, it's good to see Iron Cactus in the neighborhood, because it is just one more place to eat around the SOMA/Ballpark area, and it's another takeout option, which are scarce.  The area has Fine Dining locked down, but on the rare occasions that I'm not cooking, takeout comes up short for me.

The space is warm and inviting, large, slightly cavernous, lot's of rustic wood furnishing, high, wooded beam ceilings, polished concrete floors, complete with scattered tables and a long communal table in the center.  Dimly lit, with flowers scattered here and there, which as a florist, I'm happy to see,  a large chalk board is scratched with the standard menu as well as the specials.

As this was the first day open, and I arrived 30 minutes before closing, I'd say it was relatively bug-free for the first day,  the service was fast and very friendly.  

However, the food does need a bit of work; I ordered the Crispy tacos ($3.50) which comes with your choice of meat, beans,rice, sour cream and salsa.  I chose the spicy chicken which was tender and pleasantly pulled and stringy, but was very bland for a spicy selection.  I expected the shells to be rustic, handmade corn shells, and whole thing deep-fried (similar to what they do at Dona Tomas's Tacubaya in Berkeley) but the shell I presume was pre-purchased and perhaps flash-fried, but it wasn't objectionable; thin and crisp, with a satisfying crunch, but can get soggy quickly from the whole beans (black) and the salsas and cream.  As I don't drink soda, and only drink beer unless I plan on getting laid, a nice fruity Zinfandel from Santa Cruz, from a vineyard I knew I wasn't going to remember complimented the tacos nicely.

My friend had the spicy chicken Enchilada plate (10.50) which was tasty, but again, a bit bland.  The sauce had a good flavor with an ever so slight hint of tomato, cumin and chili powder, but it wasn't very exciting to the taste buds.  The portions were adequate, which is what they should be, as I personally feel that these places serve way too much food anyway, and since I'm not looking for value for money, I'm much more interested in quality.  The burritos from what I could see resembled overstuffed dish towels, basically the usual-size burrito that you see everywhere, that most people snarf down in one sitting but would take me a week to eat.

All and all I'd say Iron Cactus satisfies the need and perhaps if they concentrate on the food, and maybe branch out and be adventurous, then they'll get better and will probably do a great business during baseball season. 

 But I don't understand why any of these Mexican places don't cook with any exciting spices; whenever I cook Mexican food, I'm using cumin seed, garlic, cayenne pepper, ancho, pasilla and poblano peppers and chiles, achiote and chile powder.  Tacqueria-style food here in the Bay Area is so bland and lifeless and tastes the same everywhere (Azteca Tacqueria is one exception).  All of the meats usually are overcooked and the chicken is boiled instead of roasted, the shrimp is rubbery , whole beans are cooked just in water and salt and the rice is always looks flavorful, but isn't.  And the Pico de Gallo which is mistaken for 'salsa' is always made with those pink insipid, cheap, fast food quality tomatoes (as was the pdg at Iron Cactus).  Although I'm adamantly against using tomatoes past their proper seasons, perhaps these places should consider using Roma tomatoes for their Pico de Gallo, if only just for the color.  A bit more expensive, but hell, this is the Bay Area!

I'd like to see some real Mexican grandmothers open up a place, and show us what real Mexican cuisine is like, or better yet, where the hell is Rick Bayless when you need him?

excerpts: Receive a regular burrito with carnitas.
First bite...
Rice.
second bite...
Rice.
Third bite...
Rice.
Come on!
Fourth bite...
Fat!
Probably the worst burrito I've had.
I gave them one star cause the coca cola was cold.
burrito.author: Jakob B.
burrito.review: Walk in. Long line. Order a regular quesadilla with carnitas. Receive a regular burrito with carnitas. First bite... Rice. second bite... Rice. Third bite... Rice. Come on! Fourth bite... Fat! Probably the worst burrito I've had. I gave them one star cause the coca cola was cold. -__-

excerpts: The best "super burrito" on the planet can be found at the Iron Cactus.
As well as the best "al pastor".
Their margaritas and drinks are outstanding.
burrito.author: Shahram S.
burrito.review:
The best "super burrito" on the planet can be found at the Iron Cactus. As well as the best "al pastor". Their margaritas and drinks are outstanding. I am a connoisseur of healthy Mexican food, and the Iron Cactus is superb.

But there is more to this restaurant than the food. The owners are some of the kindest people I've meet. I left my wallet there by accident once, and they called me immediately to return it the next day. That says it all.

Easily the best Mexican food in Soma.

excerpts: so maybe it's a few dollars more than some other burrito spots, but whatever, this was more convenient.
I had the baby burrito and my boyfriend had the regular burrito.
The baby one was noticably smaller, but was it enough food?
Of course!
By the time I finished my burrito and chips/salsa my mouth was feeling the heat ...just how I like it.
By baby burrito with chips and salsa was $5.95 (ok $6-something including tax)
burrito.author: Caitlin B.
burrito.review:
I went here for lunch today and am am now baffled that I came back to my computer and Yelp and saw an avg of 2.5 stars?? Definitely not. 4 stars. solid.

For what it is I thought it was great!  mexican food, order at the counter, get a number, they bring it to your table. I thought they also had a nice lot of seating, with some outside too. It's not in the mission so maybe it's a few dollars more than some other burrito spots, but whatever, this was more convenient.

I had the baby burrito and my boyfriend had the regular burrito. The baby one was noticably smaller, but was it enough food? Of course! I got the spicy chicken with black beans, and there was also rice and salsa inside. The lady taking my order asked if I wanted it spicy so of course I said yes. Perk: free basket of chips and two kinds of salsa!! I definitely liked the spicy red one better than the green one. 

By the time I finished my burrito and chips/salsa my mouth was feeling the heat ...just how I like it. 

I probably wouldn't recommend going out of your way to come here, but if you are going to be in the area and are looking for an under $10 meal, well then I would definitely recommend it. By baby burrito with chips and salsa was $5.95 (ok $6-something including tax)

excerpts: Finally, I sat down to eat the torta at my office and to my surprise, there was barely any meat; should have been piled on like a burrito.
The meat was spread thin like peanut butter.
burrito.author: Nelson F.
burrito.review: Unbelievable.....BAD, SLOW, EXPENSIVE.  Ordered a torta with the al pastor meat (bbq pork) to go which was over $9. I watched and waited 20 minutes while they made burritos for people who were behind me in line.  Finally, I sat down to eat the torta at my office and to my surprise, there was barely any meat; should have been piled on like a burrito.  The meat was spread thin like peanut butter.  Additionally, no napkins and salsa were provided, they didn't even ask.   Torta was bland.  This place is on the SHIT LIST for good.

excerpts: If you don't like cold spots in your burrito
this is the place for you, because my whole burrito was piping cold.
Both friends also had plates of lukewarm food that took too long on serving time and short on flavor.
One thing the place has going for it in the food department is that the carne asada on my burrito was tender.
But unfortunately it was not warm.
Did we hit an off night?
Maybe.
Am I willing to go back to Mission Bay to give it a second shot.
No.
burrito.author: Joshua W.
burrito.review: The  Iron Cactus has a great location and look unfortunately the food is really lacking. If you don't like cold spots in your burrito this is the place for you, because my whole burrito was piping cold. Both friends also had plates of lukewarm food that took too long on serving time and short on flavor. The quesadillas were soggy and bland despite the cashier asking us if we wanted "crispy tortillas" and "spicy salsa".  One thing the place has going for it in the food department is that the carne asada on my burrito was tender. But unfortunately it was not warm. Did we hit an off night? Maybe. Am I willing to go back to Mission Bay to give it a second shot. No.

excerpts: I got a burrito bowl which was essentially a bowl of iceberg lettuce topped with a scant amount of beans, rice, and meat.
burrito.author: Saikat P.
burrito.review:
This place is very disorganized and slow.

It took them forever to take our order and then write it out and give us the receipt, which the cashier couldn't even read.

I got a burrito bowl which was essentially a bowl of iceberg lettuce topped with a scant amount of beans, rice, and meat. Quite a rip for $10.

I'm giving 2 instead of 1 star because the chicken actually didn't taste that bad, but it was dry and stringy.

excerpts: so far- first time had the taco salad with tofu, second time had a veggie burrito with tofu.
I'm fairly certain the burrito had more lettuce in it than my salad did.
I couldn't really taste the gauc in my burrito, or the sour cream, and come on now, the cheese should be included (not cost extra!).
The rice was, to be honest, pretty crap- mushy, and spicy- but not in a flavorful way.
The rice needs to be not total mush and it'd be nice to have a plain rice option, or at least a less seasoned one.
Also, there were soggy peas and carrots in my burrito-
these things have no place being in a burrito.

Actually, so much so that it sets my expectations really high- the great decor with dark wood and beautiful lanterns make me feel like I'm in a nice Mexican restaraunt, not a grab n' go burrito place.....
and so it follows that I expect certain things.
Namely, margaritas.
When this place opened, I read the menu 4 times just to make sure I wasn't missing something.
How can a Mexican place not have Margaritas???"
It looked like the kind of place that would have great ritas.

Yes, I know, Tres Agaves is right down the street, and yes, I understand this is a taqueria (even though it looks like a restaraunt), and that liquor licenses are expensive, but I still want a darn 'rita.
Pitchers of them would add so much to this place.
A 'rita  alone would add a star or two here.
I hear they have sangria, which helps, but it's still not a margarita.
burrito.author: Kristen L.
burrito.review:
This place has potential, but right now it's sittin' at 2.5 stars for me. With a few minor changes they'd easily be 3 stars in my book, maybe even up to 4 stars, but that would take more.... I'll get to that.
