I've been here twice so far- first time had the taco salad with tofu, second time had a veggie burrito with tofu. I'm fairly certain the burrito had more lettuce in it than my salad did. I couldn't really taste the gauc in my burrito, or the sour cream, and come on now, the cheese should be included (not cost extra!). The rice was, to be honest, pretty crap- mushy, and spicy- but not in a flavorful way. The rice needs to be not total mush and it'd be nice to have a plain rice option, or at least a less seasoned one. Also, there were soggy peas and carrots in my burrito- these things have no place being in a burrito. This is not Forrest Gump goes to the tacqueria, people- leave the mushy canned veggies out!

As for the tofu, I think they might be using silken tofu, or at least it tastes that way- the tofu needs to be grilled and firmer. I know, I know, it's TOFU, it's not supposed to taste great... but the thing is, when it's done well, it does. This tofu is mushy and tasteless. I think this would be a fairly easy fix- buy extra firm tofu, prep it correctly, grill it, don't leave it sitting in a vat of water/sauce with soggy canned vegetables.

The salad, too, would be an easy fix- add more lettuce, maybe mixed greens.... as it was, I felt like I was eating a bowl full of toppings. Blech. 

Ok, now the pros, and the potential-
I LOVE the atmosphere here. Actually, so much so that it sets my expectations really high- the great decor with dark wood and beautiful lanterns make me feel like I'm in a nice Mexican restaraunt, not a grab n' go burrito place.....and so it follows that I expect certain things. Namely, margaritas. When this place opened, I read the menu 4 times just to make sure I wasn't missing something. "How can a Mexican place not have Margaritas???"  It looked like the kind of place that would have great ritas. Yes, I know, Tres Agaves is right down the street, and yes, I understand this is a taqueria (even though it looks like a restaraunt), and that liquor licenses are expensive, but I still want a darn 'rita. Pitchers of them would add so much to this place. A 'rita  alone would add a star or two here. I hear they have sangria, which helps, but it's still not a margarita. Also, good sangria has booze in addition to wine in it, so I'm skeptical....unless they just get a liquor license. 

More on pros: beer on draft, good beer selection, and very generous wine pours. The chips are pretty good. Outdoor patio and convenient location. Friendly staff. 

Like I said, potential. But right now my favorite part is the decor, not the food.

excerpts: Not the best burrito I have ever had.
Not the worst burrito I have ever had.
Not the cheapest burrito I have ever had.
Not the most expensive burrito I have ever had.
This place is straight up average.
burrito.author: Caleb R.
burrito.review: Not the best burrito I have ever had.  Not the worst burrito I have ever had.  Not the cheapest burrito I have ever had.  Not the most expensive burrito I have ever had.  This place is straight up average.

excerpts: My favorite dishes are the mexican grilled chicken salad, tortilla soup and the grilled chicken burrito.
burrito.author: Heron C.
burrito.review: I'm a big fan of this place. Sure it isn't the most authentic mexican food you can get in San Francisco. But, it is fresh, healthy and flavorful. The portions are big and the prices are very reasonable. I was so happy when this place moved in because SOMA really needs more locally owned mom and pop type restaurants, which this place is. The staff and owners are always nice and its just an overall nice place to eat. Lots of room, nice decor and the back patio is great on sunny days. My favorite dishes are the mexican grilled chicken salad, tortilla soup and the grilled chicken burrito.

excerpts: Yes maybe the burrito might be better in the mission at a few places
but I only get Tacos here primarily
and they are delicious.
The Carnitas and Chicken are especially good and the Carne isnt bad also.
But on Tuesday the mini tacos are the best.
1 dollar tacos and 2 dollar coronas are great.
burrito.author: Harry E.
burrito.review: I really think these reviews are off base.  Yes maybe the burrito might be better in the mission at a few places but I only get Tacos here primarily and they are delicious.  The Carnitas and Chicken are especially good and the Carne isnt bad also.  But on Tuesday the mini tacos are the best.  1 dollar tacos and 2 dollar coronas are great.  The green sauce they have table side is up there with Cumbre on 16th and Valencia and Cancuns hots green salsa.  The people who work here push this place over to a 5 star review from 4.  Such friendly and nice people.  I always enjoy going here not only for the food and atmosphere but for the great people who work at this restaurant make it a truly great experience.  I will be there tomorrow again for delicious tacos and 2 dollar coronas to support the best Mexican restaurant in SOMA.

excerpts: Lady collecting money tried charging me $25 for a simple burrito and almost started arguing with me about it.
Burrito was ok
but I have definitely had better.
People need to start respecting their customers if they want them to come back.
Horrible service.
burrito.author: Lucy G.
burrito.review: I'll give the food two stars and the service ZERO!! Guy taking orders basically rolled his eyes at me when I started giving him my order. Could they be any more rude?!!! Lady collecting money tried charging me $25 for a simple burrito and almost started arguing with me about it. Burrito was ok but I have definitely had better. People need to start respecting their customers if they want them to come back. Horrible service.

excerpts: Why: I grabbed the fish tacos, and guacamole, my brother grabbed the burrito.
Great location, seeing that I live only 2 blocks away and there are no other taquerias nearby.
The only negative thing I saw at this new place was there were no substitutes for ingredients that they made to order.
For example, on my fish tacos, instead of sour cream I wanted guacamole and was told very strictly, that there were NO substitutes.
Interesting at a made to order place.
But the fish tacos were excellent as well as guacamole.
And my brother who should be the King of Burritos was impressed by his steak burrito.
A huge plus that this place is attached to my favorite coffee place-
The Creamery.
burrito.author: R P.
burrito.review:
Who: My brother and I.
What: My brother is obsessed with Mexican food.
When: For a late lunch, 2 PM.
Why: I grabbed the fish tacos, and guacamole, my brother grabbed the burrito. Great location, seeing that I live only 2 blocks away and there are no other taquerias nearby. The only negative thing I saw at this new place was there were no substitutes for ingredients that they made to order. For example, on my fish tacos, instead of sour cream I wanted guacamole and was told very strictly, that there were NO substitutes. Interesting at a made to order place. But the fish tacos were excellent as well as guacamole. And my brother who should be the King of Burritos was impressed by his steak burrito. A huge plus that this place is attached to my favorite coffee place- The Creamery.

excerpts: The atmosphere is great, especially during sports games, I love the look of the place, staff is always really friendly and recognizes me every time I come in and, oh ye the whole reason I come here, ... my Super Burrito!
burrito.author: Sebastiaan v.
burrito.review:
This place is fantastic! I moved right around the corner from the Iron Cactus a couple of months ago and and have been going here twice a week ever since. The atmosphere is great, especially during sports games, I love the look of the place, staff is always really friendly and recognizes me every time I come in and, oh ye the whole reason I come here, ... my Super Burrito! 

The place seems to be doing very well and is always packed before and after the Giants games. Another good thing is that they have whole wheat tortillas here!!! something which I can never find at Chipotle. 

My girlfriend loves the chicken tacos they have here too and on Tuesday they are only 1$ each. Finally, the fact that I can get my Cappuccino right next door makes me a happy customer.

Basically I am very grateful to have the Iron Cactus in my neighborhood and love getting my lunch and dinner here on a weekly basis. I would like to see more fun places like this in SF!

excerpts: This place is good for a quick burrito
and it's *definitely* improved since opening.
We don't have a taco truck :( and this ain't the mission, so when I'm craving mexican this does the job.
And it's relatively cheap and fast.
burrito.author: Tiffany C.
burrito.review: My review will be biased since there are no other mexican restaurants (other than Tres agaves) in the 5 block radius of my SOMA apartment.  This place is good for a quick burrito and it's *definitely* improved since opening.  We don't have a taco truck :( and this ain't the mission, so when I'm craving mexican this does the job.  And it's relatively cheap and fast.

excerpts: After that she inexplicably decided to tack on a burrito to my order.
The manager was pleasant, however, and quickly refunded me the burrito bucks.
The food took significantly longer than I expected to arrive, and when it did it was savory but not spectacular.
burrito.author: Max G.
burrito.review:
Having seen the Cactus being built as it's just down the street from me I was excited to check it out last Friday after a long day at work.
First off - this isn't really a restaurant, it's more of a fast food joint. You order your grub at the counter, pay for it and take a number. Nothing wrong with that (almost all the best Mexican food I've had was from street vendors), just don't come here expecting white table cloths and a mariachi band.
Unfortunately the level of service is belied even by the humble interior (I guess they're going for the faux vintage look that's inexplicably still popular in SOMA). It took 5 minutes to explain my complicated order of 2 soft tacos, 2 crispy tacos and a 'dilla to the cashier. After that she inexplicably decided to tack on a burrito to my order. The manager was pleasant, however, and quickly refunded me the burrito bucks.
The food took significantly longer than I expected to arrive, and when it did it was savory but not spectacular. None of the dishes were memorable and the ingredients, while allegedly fresh, were rather bland and had to rely on the salsa for flavor.
If the Iron Cactus gets competent staff and jazzes up their dishes (or at least obtains a full liquor license so they can serve margaritas) then they have all the makings of a success. Until then I'll keep getting my neighborhood Mexican fix at Tres Agaves.

excerpts: the happy hour deals and the mini burrito.
The food is overpriced and the service is extremely slow for an establishment that caters to lunch for 9-5ers.
burrito.author: Laura S.
burrito.review: I'm happy to finally have a decent taqueria walking distance from work and this place has a lot of potential but is falling short.  The 3 stars are for organic, sustainable ingredients, the happy hour deals and the mini burrito.  The food is overpriced and the service is extremely slow for an establishment that caters to lunch for 9-5ers.

excerpts: And $7 for a veg burrito that doesn't even have avocado?
Come on.
burrito.author: peter j.
burrito.review: Edible, but bland and overpriced. The spicy salsa was totally flavorless. And $7 for a veg burrito that doesn't even have avocado? Come on.

excerpts: I find it hard to believe that they can't get even a simple bean and rice burrito to taste decent.
I have on two occasions asked them to make this spicy and both times
now it's about as bland and unspicy as I think is possible to make it.
burrito.author: j d.
burrito.review: OK, I don't think there's any reason a review and rating for a restaurant can't be based on trying just one or two items.  With that said...I find it hard to believe that they can't get even a simple bean and rice burrito to taste decent.  I have on two occasions asked them to make this spicy and both times now it's about as bland and unspicy as I think is possible to make it.  And the salsa used might as well be genetically modified cardboard.  Blah!  Also tried some fish tacos once and they were equally null and void of flavor.  I think I'll pass on this place in the future.

excerpts: The chicken burrito "wet" with spicy ranchero sauce was fantastic, service was friendly and fast, the portions were huge, and the price point was right on target.
This is the best mexican restaurant in the area, hands down.
burrito.author: Chase N.
burrito.review: Went back again today, this place seriously rocks.  The chicken burrito "wet" with spicy ranchero sauce was fantastic, service was friendly and fast, the portions were huge, and the price point was right on target.  This is the best mexican restaurant in the area, hands down.

excerpts: 5 stars for the only good tofu burrito in the city.
Also, the architecture somehow makes the food taste better.
burrito.author: Krishan G.
burrito.review: 5 stars for the only good tofu burrito in the city.  Also, the architecture somehow makes the food taste better.

excerpts: Boyfriend had a burrito and thought it was just fine.
If you're in the mood for quick Mexican and you're in the area, check it out.
Good food but probably not good enough to trek all over SF for.
burrito.author: Christina S.
burrito.review: Went here for a quick dinner because it was super close to my apartment.  The chicken on my salad was amazing -- I was surprised at just how good it was.  Boyfriend had a burrito and thought it was just fine.  If you're in the mood for quick Mexican and you're in the area, check it out.  Good food but probably not good enough to trek all over SF for.

excerpts: Burrito was good size
Atmosphere is

:
Offer a "super" or "wet" burrito including all the options - guac, sour cream, cheese, salsa etc.
s
burrito.author: Kev S.
burrito.review:
We went there on Tuesday night aroudn 8PM.
It was not too busy so we walked right up to the counter.
We both love burritos so I ordered the beef and my partner ordered the chicken.   
Like many of the reviews we were amazed that we had to pay extra for CHEESE???   (I am from Wisconsin where normally cheese is included on everything for free :-)

I should have looked at my receipt because I saw someone mention that they charge 50cents for chips?   I just assumed they came with it and they were on my plate.  I will have to check on that.  Its not very clear.

The other odd thing was there was a guy there that I think was the owner or manager.  He walked around in and out of the kitchen.  He looked exhausted and very unhappy.   I am sure starting a restaurant is a nightmare but if it was me I would have put on a happy face and said hello to people and welcomed them and asked them how things were.   He basically ignored the existence of all the customers never once talking to anyone but the staff???


The space is great.  The people were friendly to us but the food was my big concern reading the reviews.  Luckily both of us really liked our burritos and they were pretty good size.  I have to say the steak had some really good seasoning.   What I didnt like was the little salsa containers on the tables.  I just do not think that is sanitary having little social salsa pots all over the place.   This is a city full of all kinds of people and I dont know what the last 10 people did with that container and spoon.  ugh.... I wish I could have gotten my salsa from a salsa bar or on the side.

So to sum it up:

Pros:
Food was good
Burrito was good size
Atmosphere is cool but mellow


Cons:
Cheese is extra?  Wrong....
Public salsa jars - yuck
Needs a personality.  Staff was nice but distant - manager had head in sand.

Recommendations to owners:
Offer a "super" or "wet" burrito including all the options - guac, sour cream, cheese, salsa etc. s
Salsa bar... or salsa on the side
Ask your patrons what they think - smile and welcome them...

Chow!

excerpts: I ordered their super burrito and it was HUGE and delicious.
I couldn't wait to go back.
NOW second time around - I ordered the super burrito again, paid $9.58 for the damn thing, got it, looked in the bag and sincerely thought they got my order wrong.
This burrito
(if that's what you want to call it) was the size of a banana, no joke.
I went back up to the counter to explain that there must have been a mistake.
The guy at the register looks at me like I'm crazy and says "Nope, it's a super".
OK I'm not an idiot,
last time I was here the "super" was a lot larger than a banana, and I was actually satisfied that my ten bucks was well spent.
But sure enough this asshole rudely told me that I was wrong and that my banana size burrito was indeed a super.
I will NEVER ever go back to this place.
Rude customer service, and they have no problem ripping you off.
I will be telling everyone I know not to come here.
burrito.author: Kerry Z.
burrito.review: The first time I came here, it was great no doubt about it.  I ordered their super burrito and it was HUGE and delicious.  I couldn't wait to go back.  NOW second time around - I ordered the super burrito again, paid $9.58 for the damn thing, got it, looked in the bag and sincerely thought they got my order wrong.  This burrito (if that's what you want to call it) was the size of a banana, no joke.  I went back up to the counter to explain that there must have been a mistake.  The guy at the register looks at me like I'm crazy and says "Nope, it's a super".  OK I'm not an idiot, last time I was here the "super" was a lot larger than a banana, and I was actually satisfied that my ten bucks was well spent.  But sure enough this asshole rudely told me that I was wrong and that my banana size burrito was indeed a super.  I will NEVER ever go back to this place.  Rude customer service, and they have no problem ripping you off.  I will be telling everyone I know not to come here.

excerpts: The breakfast burrito on Sunday was fantastic.
burrito.author: Mike D.
burrito.review:
Come on Yelp-sters, give this kid a chance.  I happen to work around the corner from this place, and I've been there a half-dozen times since it opened.  
Yes, the first week the food was rough around the edges.  
But it's coming together.  The breakfast burrito on Sunday was fantastic.

And the space is nothing less than great -- vaulted ceilings with exposed original wood, and a skylight.  It's becoming a solid place to throw back lunch, in a neighborhood desperate for something (anything) decent.

excerpts: Instead of making the burrito while you pick your ingredients, they write everything down first and make you wait a really long time while they make it.
And even though they wrote my order down they STILL got it wrong.
When I asked them to make a chicken fajita burrito with grilled peppers and onions, they told me "we're not allowed to give you that" even though I've gotten it two times before.
I like the refried black beans that you can't find at every Mexican place, but other than that not that great...
It has the potential to be a lot better.
burrito.author: Seeta S.
burrito.review:
The way they make you order is so inefficient. Instead of making the burrito while you pick your ingredients, they write everything down first and make you wait a really long time while they make it. And even though they wrote my order down they STILL got it wrong. They also make you pay extra for everything- cheese, sour cream, guacamole. 

When I asked them to make a chicken fajita burrito with grilled peppers and onions, they told me "we're not allowed to give you that" even though I've gotten it two times before. 
I like the refried black beans that you can't find at every Mexican place, but other than that not that great... 
It has the potential to be a lot better.

excerpts: I had a steak burrito, which unfortunately was worse than my usual steak burritos from Chipotle.
The food itself wasn't bad at all, but the steak tasted almost chewier than usual and didn't have quite as much flavor.
When I got it, I was surprised to feel that one side was unusually cold, while the other side was piping hot.
Although I was concerned that I would have to return it to the kitchen, I unwrapped it only to find all the hot items on one side, while the cold corn and vegetables were in another section.
The atmosphere of the restaurant was quite lively, but the music from the radio often drowned out our conversation at the table.
I appreciated the TV in the corner though, which was set on a news channel reporting news.
It reminded me a little bit of being back at Free Speech Movement cafe at Cal, with the silent news playing in the background.
burrito.author: Stephanie S.
burrito.review: Popular Spanish restaurant almost right across the street from the Caltrain station. I had a steak burrito, which unfortunately was worse than my usual steak burritos from Chipotle. The food itself wasn't bad at all, but the steak tasted almost chewier than usual and didn't have quite as much flavor. When I got it, I was surprised to feel that one side was unusually cold, while the other side was piping hot. Although I was concerned that I would have to return it to the kitchen, I unwrapped it only to find all the hot items on one side, while the cold corn and vegetables were in another section. The atmosphere of the restaurant was quite lively, but the music from the radio often drowned out our conversation at the table. I appreciated the TV in the corner though, which was set on a news channel reporting news. It reminded me a little bit of being back at Free Speech Movement cafe at Cal, with the silent news playing in the background.

excerpts: The pork was pretty much flavorless and they didn't really seem to know how to correctly wrap the burrito (you'd get a mouthful of one item at a time).
The lady preparing my husband's burrito wasn't thrilled when he asked for corn and hot sauce.
The place really does look great and we are thrilled to have a burrito place in the neighborhood.
burrito.author: Laura B.
burrito.review:
Pretty disappointed w/ our first trip here but we are willing to give it another shot. 

The place itself is very cute (decor wise). The burritos..well they left a lot to be desired. The guy making mine had no idea what he was doing. He wasn't even sure what a whole wheat tortilla was - so he just used plain. The pork was pretty much flavorless and they didn't really seem to know how to correctly wrap the burrito (you'd get a mouthful of one item at a time). The lady preparing my husband's burrito wasn't thrilled when he asked for corn and hot sauce. 

Overall - not great food. BUT we will be optimistic and hope they start adding some flavor to the meat. The place really does look great and we are thrilled to have a burrito place in the neighborhood.

excerpts: Some healthy options like burrito bowl, etc..
burrito.author: John B.
burrito.review: This place is exaclty what it should be, for where it is. Busy during the lunch hours, and good amount of traffic, so the food is always fresh. Some healthy options like burrito bowl, etc.. They thought about the little things, like keeping the home-made salsa on ice, some big flat screens up in the corners for enertainment, high open ceilings..its just a good feel.

excerpts: The baby burrito I ordered
was soo
bland...
The place was very slow with not that many patrons.. and the wait for my baby burrito... nearly 20 minutes!!!
its like my burrito disappeared for awhile... never ever again will I go to this establishment!
I wonder if the owner ever tried mexican food.. this place needs serious over-haul!
burrito.author: Jasen L.
burrito.review: This is the worst place for mexican food ever!!!  The baby burrito I ordered was soo bland... i had to dump salsa all over it to give it any sort of taste!  I was with my friend walking back to her place and I mentioned to her that I was hungry.  She suggested The Iron Cactus because it was across the street but she warned me that the food is not the best.  I thought I'd give it a try... The ordering, paying, and getting my food seemed and was so complicated... and they were SO DAMN SLOW!!  Other taquerias that I go into the city have great systems getting those burritos down the assembly line.  There is no assembly line here what-so-ever!  The place was very slow with not that many patrons.. and the wait for my baby burrito... nearly 20 minutes!!! its like my burrito disappeared for awhile... never ever again will I go to this establishment!  I wonder if the owner ever tried mexican food.. this place needs serious over-haul!

excerpts: The neighborhood needed a great Taqueria and Iron Cactus rolled out the red carpet opening in a renovated space which appeared all set to take care of our quality burrito needs that Victors down the street has given up on long ago.
Looks are deceiving, because my Iron Cactus report card is that of a high school drop out.
You walk in and it just gets ridiculous right off the bat.
This isnt a one time gig, I have been here on numerous occasions with different friends and its a joke and I read all these reviews
and they are saying the same thing.
I say no rice, I get rice, I say black beans, I get pinto.
I get pieces of corn and other ingredients that appear to have fallen into my burrito by cross spooning ingredients.
Each time I go over the order to be sure its correct, but it doesnt even matter.
Then were at the register paying and every time I have been here
this has been a deer in the headlights process.
They even modeled themselves after Poncho Villa?
Excuse me?
The same place that pulled a grand opening, grand closing next to the Ferry Building where its impossible to fail because thousands of well educated people with cash walk past your front door?
I personally hate Poncho Villa because their burritos are flavorless, um, next on the review, the flavor of Iron Cactus is pathetic.
These burritos suck.
I have gotten them to go, and its cold by the time I get home just a block away.
Please read these reviews and figure it out over there, we all wanted this restaurant to do great, and instead they dont have a clue.
This place is a joke!
burrito.author: Michael G.
burrito.review: My first review tee'd this place up in hopes of nothing but success. What a let down! The neighborhood needed a great Taqueria and Iron Cactus rolled out the red carpet opening in a renovated space which appeared all set to take care of our quality burrito needs that Victors down the street has given up on long ago. Looks are deceiving, because my Iron Cactus report card is that of a high school drop out. You walk in and it just gets ridiculous right off the bat. This isnt a one time gig, I have been here on numerous occasions with different friends and its a joke and I read all these reviews and they are saying the same thing. I say no rice, I get rice, I say black beans, I get pinto. I get pieces of corn and other ingredients that appear to have fallen into my burrito by cross spooning ingredients. Each time I go over the order to be sure its correct, but it doesnt even matter. Then were at the register paying and every time I have been here this has been a deer in the headlights process. They even modeled themselves after Poncho Villa? Excuse me? The same place that pulled a grand opening, grand closing next to the Ferry Building where its impossible to fail because thousands of well educated people with cash walk past your front door? I personally hate Poncho Villa because their burritos are flavorless, um, next on the review, the flavor of Iron Cactus is pathetic. These burritos suck. I have gotten them to go, and its cold by the time I get home just a block away. Please read these reviews and figure it out over there, we all wanted this restaurant to do great, and instead they dont have a clue. This place is a joke!

excerpts: burrito is amazing.
There are a lot of mediocre food-line mexican places, but this is not one of them...love IC!
burrito.author: JOHN O.
burrito.review: Fantastic casual mexican spot. I go for lunch 3-4 times a week. Spicy shrimp salad is awesome (super spicy) and super wet burrito is amazing. There are a lot of mediocre food-line mexican places, but this is not one of them...love IC!

excerpts: I thought this place was pretty good - I like their burrito bowls and salads.
Over all pretty tasty.
I came here on their opening day when they were still working out the kinks.
They seem to have a good system now.
Their happy hour rocks - affordable beer YAY!
It's a nice alternative to Tres Agave in the neighborhood - not as expensive or crowded - more on the affordable and casual end.
Too bad they don't have tequila there.
burrito.author: Christie W.
burrito.review: I thought this place was pretty good - I like their burrito bowls and salads. Over all pretty tasty. I came here on their opening day when they were still working out the kinks. They seem to have a good system now. Their happy hour rocks - affordable beer YAY! It's a nice alternative to Tres Agave in the neighborhood - not as expensive or crowded - more on the affordable and casual end. Too bad they don't have tequila there.

excerpts: This time I had a grilled chicken burrito again very tasty and washed down with an ice cold beer.
So, so far so good, still working my way through the menu.
Decor is great, service friendly and it looks clean.
I'll only visit if I can get served quickly which is sadly my normal lunch speed.
burrito.author: Kevin S.
burrito.review: Seems to be a real mixed bag of reviews for the Iron Cactus, here's my addition. If you work in this area, like me, you should very happy to see another lunchtime choice for food, so that's worth a couple of stars right there. I suppose it's been open a couple of months now and should be settled in its operation. I have visited twice and had to forget it once because of the line out the down and down the street. First visit: spicy chicken taco, delicious, in and out fast and surprisingly cheap. Second visit: The guy taking my order could hardly speak English, after three attempts of trying to understand what he was asking me I just shrugged my shoulders and said yes to what ever he was asking me. This time I had a grilled chicken burrito again very tasty and washed down with an ice cold beer. So, so far so good, still working my way through the menu. Decor is great, service friendly and it looks clean. I'll only visit if I can get served quickly which is sadly my normal lunch speed.

excerpts: i wanted to basically make my own burrito by telling them what i wanted in it since i didnt see the one i wanted on the menu.
they couldnt figure out how to price it and so basically for a no meat burrito it was around 10.00.
burrito.author: Julie G.
burrito.review: A pricey taqueria.  i wanted to basically make my own burrito by telling them what i wanted in it since i didnt see the one i wanted on the menu.  they couldnt figure out how to price it and so basically for a no meat burrito it was around 10.00.

excerpts: I get the tofu burrito.
The food I don't feel is anything special.
I will stop by to pick something up for dinner on my way home from work occasionally.
The food is pretty fresh, and feels healthy.
There are happy hour specials
lthat ook really good.
burrito.author: raj g.
burrito.review: The food is good and the price is fair. I get the tofu burrito. The food I don't feel is anything special. I will stop by to pick something up for dinner on my way home from work occasionally. The food is pretty fresh, and feels healthy. There are happy hour specials lthat ook really good.

excerpts: That's $5.90 for a "baby burrito" (rice, beans, salsa; cheese is extra).
Third Street Grill made this mistake when it first opened, too, but it has since added a veggie burrito option with lower pricing.

Also, service at The Iron Cactus is super slow and inefficient -- maybe they should take some tips from Mexico Au Parc (which I am also not too keen on but which I do not loathe) to see how to cycle people through?
burrito.author: Midori S.
burrito.review: I, too, loathe Victor's and Chavo's and was super excited to see The Iron Cactus open shop. The space is cool, and the burritos are actually better than the aforementioned places'. However, The Iron Cactus is super uncool to charge the same amount for burritos with without meat as for burritos with meat. That's $5.90 for a "baby burrito" (rice, beans, salsa; cheese is extra). Third Street Grill made this mistake when it first opened, too, but it has since added a veggie burrito option with lower pricing. Also, service at The Iron Cactus is super slow and inefficient -- maybe they should take some tips from Mexico Au Parc (which I am also not too keen on but which I do not loathe) to see how to cycle people through?

excerpts: I just ordered a chicken burrito with black beans, not very adventuress I know
.I
saw they had beers on tape
so I ordered a Fat Tire (It was a Friday )
.It is not easy to find a place that does good fast Mexican food around 4th & Brannan.
The service was fast and the staff really friendly.
It only opened a few weeks ago but I would definitely go back.
It is connected to The Creamery coffee shop
so I just walked in there and got a double shot of espresso to get through Friday afternoon.
burrito.author: Mark L.
burrito.review: I went here today for lunch.I was there last week and it was crazy busy .I preferred it today with less people.I liked it a lot.It didn't look like the typical Taqueria.I am a bit of an interior snob.It has a beautiful old wood ceiling and a concrete floor.I  liked the feel of the place.It was raining pretty hard outside so I didn't have to wait in line.I just ordered a chicken burrito with black beans, not very adventuress I know .I saw they had beers on tape so I ordered a Fat Tire (It was a Friday ) .It is not easy to find a place that does good fast Mexican food around 4th & Brannan.The service was fast and the staff really friendly.It only opened a few weeks ago but I would definitely go back. It is connected to The Creamery coffee shop so I just walked in there and got a double shot of espresso to get through Friday afternoon.

excerpts: Esp since that is 90 % of the burrito they stuff in there.
The steak is msg ridden with no beef flavor.
I agree, I want to have a good burrito place around here
but this is just ridiculous, i would rather have a taco bell than this piece of trash.
The place is also wayy too cold.
maybe i'll go for a beer but food?
i don't think so.
this place has the personality of the ridiculous coffee shop next door.
I can only say that i am glad there aren't too many people who go there since i don't want to run into a crowd of non food knowing people when i take my daily walk.
I can say that i will let my dog do his business around this place tho.
Why so upset?
Cuz i love my california burritos and i can't believe  they must have money to burn.
I will visit again in 8 days.
btw, they didn't even put salsa in my burrito.

burrito.review:
Ok, I will give it a chance.
But before I go back, I want the cooks to go to Chipotle and learn how to cook rice.
The rice is miserable.  Esp since that is 90 % of the burrito they stuff in there.
The steak is msg ridden with no beef flavor.
The salsa? omg, it is sooo bland.  
The mexican people who work there are not happy to have a job.  They are smiling thru their angry teeth, is it that bad to work there???
I agree, I want to have a good burrito place around here but this is just ridiculous, i would rather have a taco bell than this piece of trash.  The place is also wayy too cold.  maybe i'll go for a beer but food? i don't think so.  this place has the personality of the ridiculous coffee shop next door.  
I can only say that i am glad there aren't too many people who go there since i don't want to run into a crowd of non food knowing people when i take my daily walk.
I can say that i will let my dog do his business around this place tho.
Why so upset? Cuz i love my california burritos and i can't believe  they must have money to burn.
I will visit again in 8 days.  if it does not change, the rice, the salsa, 
and whatnot i will be peessed. btw, they didn't even put salsa in my burrito.  i had to ask for chips and salsa, omg!

excerpts: The burrito bowl is my go to
but I've had other things here.
Consistently excellent.
burrito bowl.author: Frank C.
burrito bowl.review: I've been going here on the way into the ballpark for many years. ALWAYS good. A much better version of Chipotle. I have no idea why the rating is so low. The burrito bowl is my go to but I've had other things here. Consistently excellent.

excerpts: I got a veggie burrito bowl after verbally wrestling with the staff.
I attempted to explain my food allergies in both English and Spanish, neither of which worked.
Still not really sure if they were being honest or just agreeing to get me out of their face.
...guess I'll find out in a couple hours if the reaction hits.
The veggies on the burrito bowl were soggy and poorly cooked.
Really just a pile of bland zucchini.
Gave them two stars instead of one because the rice was pretty good.
The veggies on the burrito bowl were soggy and poorly cooked.
Really just a pile of bland zucchini.
Gave them two stars instead of one because the rice was pretty good.
burrito bowl.author: Natalie P.
burrito bowl.review:
Not impressed with food or service. I got a veggie burrito bowl after verbally wrestling with the staff. I attempted to explain my food allergies in both English and Spanish, neither of which worked. Still not really sure if they were being honest or just agreeing to get me out of their face. ...guess I'll find out in a couple hours if the reaction hits. 
The veggies on the burrito bowl were soggy and poorly cooked. Really just a pile of bland zucchini. 
Gave them two stars instead of one because the rice was pretty good.

excerpts: And my burrito bowl was something I could make at home.
But wouldn't.
Because I don't use canned beans and rice.
Embarrassing.
This place made me sad.
burrito bowl.author: Jordan S.
burrito bowl.review:
Came craving mexican food, and left craving mexican food.
The monster burrito was no monster. And my burrito bowl was something I could make at home. But wouldn't. Because I don't use canned beans and rice. Embarrassing. This place made me sad.

excerpts: I got the Burrito Bowl with Tofu ($7!
$7 for a burrito!).
Their chips are clearly from a bag, their salsas taste stale and processed straight from a bottle.
The beans and tofu were not well cooked, and the "salad" is just iceberg lettuce.
Never have I seen such a lack of effort, especially in SF where there are amazing restaurants - especially Mexican ones.
I could've thrown together a better burrito myself, or gone to Chipotle and gotten a much healther, filling option with fresh veggies for half the price.
burrito bowl.author: Bee M.
burrito bowl.review:
The only reason this place still has customers is because they are so close to the ballpark.

I got the Burrito Bowl with Tofu ($7! $7 for a burrito!).  Their chips are clearly from a bag, their salsas taste stale and processed straight from a bottle.  The beans and tofu were not well cooked, and the "salad" is just iceberg lettuce.  Never have I seen such a lack of effort, especially in SF where there are amazing restaurants - especially Mexican ones.  I could've thrown together a better burrito myself, or gone to Chipotle and gotten a much healther, filling option with fresh veggies for half the price.

excerpts: I have a myriad of intestinal disorders that make me able to only eat certain foods and the burrito bowl with guacamole
does me right every time.
I learned I was also lactose intolerant which a lot of people don't know they are and blame Mexican food when in fact, it's that they're lactose intolerant and should skip the sour cream!
The Iron Cactus does me right
burrito bowl.author: Brent S.
burrito bowl.review:
I live and work near The Iron Cactus and I eat there about 5 times a week. The food is great and the owners are friendly and always recognize me and make me feel welcome.

I have a myriad of intestinal disorders that make me able to only eat certain foods and the burrito bowl with guacamole does me right every time. I learned I was also lactose intolerant which a lot of people don't know they are and blame Mexican food when in fact, it's that they're lactose intolerant and should skip the sour cream! The Iron Cactus does me right and I have about one of the most sensitive guts out there.

I don't see why they don't have a 5 star rating - when the ball games are packing the place, sure, every business gets slow when you have a line out the door it seems like any place takes a long time - this place is worth the wait, every time.

excerpts: I switch back and forth between the burrito bowl and the enchilada plate - you can't go wrong either way!
burrito bowl.author: Sarah R.
burrito bowl.review:
We love the Iron Cactus. 

My husband, 2 y.o. son and I come in about once a week - my son would live off of their rice and black beans if we allowed him to! We're always greeted with a smile. 

Food is great - everything is perfectly seasoned and hits the spot when you're craving Mexican food. I switch back and forth between the burrito bowl and the enchilada plate - you can't go wrong either way!

We recently had our son's birthday party on their patio and it couldn't have been more perfect. We took suggestions on the food and layout from Ivor, the owner, and he hit it out of the ball park going above and beyond our expectations. There was plenty of yummy food, the weather was perfect, and the space was ideal for little kids - the back door to the patio was closed, so the kids had a safe, contained play space. The adults had plenty of sangria and beer, and no one left hungry! Sal, our host/server, worked hard to ensure we had everything we needed. It was a fantastic day.

Do consider the Iron Cactus for your next party or get-together. It really is a gem right here in SOMA!

excerpts: Burrito bowl comes with no carnitas on top as ordered.
burrito bowl.author: l c.
burrito bowl.review:
If good intentions could make food get prepared correctly and taste good, I'd be a happy Iron Cactus customer.  Alas, that's just not the way the world works.  

As others have mentioned, they opened fairly recently, so I'm willing to give it another shot in a few months.  Here are the issues we encountered though:

1) The guy taking the order didn't seem to know the menu. I said, 1 veggie taco plate has 2 tacos right? He said, okay 2 veggie tacos. I said, no just 1 veggie taco plate. He said, okay 1 veggie taco. I said, no I want the plate, with 2 tacos. He did not say anything and wrote down veggie taco plate with a 2 next to it.  Hmm, okay, we'll figure that out later.  

2) The guy who takes the order writes it down in English, but the woman filling the order doesn't know English. He then translates it to Spanish for her. Sorry, but that kinda ruins the assembly-line concept. 

3) At the register, I clarify the taco situation. There's a guacamole situation too, but this is getting long-winded.  We go outside and wait for food.

4) The food takes awhile. 1 fish taco plate comes with 2 naked fish tacos and beans and rice on the side. The other fish taco plate comes with 2 fish tacos with guacamole & sour cream on top, and no beans and rice on the side. Burrito bowl comes with no carnitas on top as ordered.

5) Nice man comes and puts carnitas on top of bowl and comes out with another fish taco plate. This time it has sour cream & beans & rice.  

So, in summary, what you order may not be what you get, and it probably won't taste very good, but it will be served with a smile!

excerpts: If I am very hungry I go with the Burrito bowl which is only $6.00.
Their Melon or Cantelop Frescas are fantastic on a sunny day.
~This is a popular spot as it is attached to the Creamery which is a very popular crepe house/cafe.

Come early and leave satisfied!
~Our office at Dolby has started to use them for catered events!
burrito bowl.author: Patrick F.
burrito bowl.review:
Great Mexican food period! I go here everyday for lunch and get one of their many salads if you want something light instead of a burger or sandwich. I recommend the Cactus Combination Salad if you like shrimp, steak and chicken all in one go.Nothing like paying $8.00 for a $12.00 salad They don't spare the avocados either. If I am very hungry I go with the Burrito bowl which is only $6.00. Their Melon or Cantelop Frescas are fantastic on a sunny day.
~This is a popular spot as it is attached to the Creamery which is a very popular crepe house/cafe. Come early and leave satisfied!
~Our office at Dolby has started to use them for catered events!

..it is ready.

HOLLA.
The Burrito bowl comes with chips.
They have some spicy sauce in a bottle by the counter.

burrito bowl.author: Christopher L.
burrito bowl.review: I come here about once or twice a month. This is the closest and most legit Mexican food in the area. It's about 2 short blocks away from China Basin. There is another place down the block however it is pretty crappy. Ill write a review for that place when I have time. It is going to be full of lulz.  Anyways..the only thing I ever get is the Super burrito bowl. I phone in my order and by the time I get there (around 10 mins)..it is ready. Show my badge and I get a discount. HOLLA. The Burrito bowl comes with chips. They have some spicy sauce in a bottle by the counter. I grab that and give my burrito bowl a quick splash. I don't recommend eating the burrito bowl to often as it is pretty heavy/filling.

excerpts: I ordered the burrito bowl, something I'm a big fan of.
Theirs didn't turn out so well as they used finely shredded lettuce that just ended up being a soupy mess at the bottom.
I will definitely be back to find out what their burritos are like.
burrito bowl.author: D. D.
burrito bowl.review:
I'm giving Iron Cactus 5 stars for their customer service! Good customer service is hard to find these days and I was pleasantly surprised to have been treated so well at the Iron Cactus. 

It was lunch rush hour and their credit card machine was down. They did their best and tried to save everyone time by just taking card numbers down. When I had a problem with the charge the next day, they fixed everything no questions asked. 

As for the food, it was ok. I ordered the burrito bowl, something I'm a big fan of. Theirs didn't turn out so well as they used finely shredded lettuce that just ended up being a soupy mess at the bottom. I will definitely be back to find out what their burritos are like. I think I just ordered the wrong thing. 

The management at this place still gets 5 big ones from me!!!!! Thank you!

excerpts: Like: being able to order at the counter and completely customize what I do and don't want on my nachos or burrito bowl.
burrito bowl.author: Macy M.
burrito bowl.review:
Love: $3.00 3pm-6pm ( 7-day a week) draft Happy Hour and a heated dog-friendy patio AND tofu as a 'meat' option. 

Like: being able to order at the counter and completely customize what I do and don't want on my nachos or burrito bowl.  Also like the food prices overall and nice staff.

Not So Much: The food lacks flavor ( you don't crave it next week) and seems overcooked, kinda soft. Chipolte is going to charge you more for beers, but give a more flavorful experience you want to go back to.

excerpts: Had the burrito bowl, which is basically a salad, spicy which had fresh chopped jalepenos, yum.
Love the free chips, yea.
burrito bowl.author: Jessica G.
burrito bowl.review: Glad to have found a burrito joint near work for lunch! Had the burrito bowl, which is basically a salad, spicy which had fresh chopped jalepenos, yum. Love the free chips, yea.

excerpts: If I order a Burrito bowl, I get a burrito.
If I order cheese enchiladas I get chicken enchiladas.
And today I order a simple tostada; the menu says it comes with rice, no rice to be found.
I likely won't eat here again even though it's pretty good Mexican food because it drives me crazy that my order it always wrong!
It is always a bit loud in there, maybe that's why?
The staff is having a hard time hearing the orders?
I don't know....
burrito bowl.author: Sarah B.
burrito bowl.review: This place always always screws up my order.  The food would get a strong 4 stars if they could just get my order right.  9 times out of 10 it's wrong.  And I'm not that complicated.  If I order a Burrito bowl, I get a burrito. If I order cheese enchiladas I get chicken enchiladas.  And today I order a simple tostada; the menu says it comes with rice, no rice to be found.  I likely won't eat here again even though it's pretty good Mexican food because it drives me crazy that my order it always wrong! It is always a bit loud in there, maybe that's why?  The staff is having a hard time hearing the orders?  I don't know....

excerpts: I got a burrito bowl which was essentially a bowl of iceberg lettuce topped with a scant amount of beans, rice, and meat.
burrito bowl.author: Saikat P.
burrito bowl.review:
This place is very disorganized and slow.

It took them forever to take our order and then write it out and give us the receipt, which the cashier couldn't even read.

I got a burrito bowl which was essentially a bowl of iceberg lettuce topped with a scant amount of beans, rice, and meat. Quite a rip for $10.

I'm giving 2 instead of 1 star because the chicken actually didn't taste that bad, but it was dry and stringy.

excerpts: Some healthy options like burrito bowl, etc..

burrito bowl.review: This place is exaclty what it should be, for where it is. Busy during the lunch hours, and good amount of traffic, so the food is always fresh. Some healthy options like burrito bowl, etc.. They thought about the little things, like keeping the home-made salsa on ice, some big flat screens up in the corners for enertainment, high open ceilings..its just a good feel.

Fast and friendly service !
quesadilla.author: Georgiy R.
quesadilla.review: This place is super close to where I work and I've walked by it multiple times. The super quesadilla here is the best. Fast and friendly service !

excerpts: However, I LOVE their cheese quesadilla with beans and rice and a small side of sour cream.
quesadilla.author: Megan B.
quesadilla.review:
I am pretty much vegetarian and dislike tofu so I cannot speak to the meat/tofu burritos, tacos, etc. However, I LOVE their cheese quesadilla with beans and rice and a small side of sour cream. I know it's pretty much comfort, but it's so yummy! 

Other pros:
-Helpful and nice staff
-Efficient service
-Heavy pours of wine/beer 
-Clean place
-Free chips and salsa if you order an entree 
-Close to AT&T Park and Caltrain stop

excerpts: I ordered the Cheese Quesadilla, simple.
When we got to the cashier, we paid & were given a small basket of chips.
My quesadilla was surprisingly bigger than I expected
I asked for Guac on the side (not bad)
It was good
, how can you really go wrong with it?
quesadilla.author: Camille C.
quesadilla.review:
Apparently in SF, places close between lunch & dinner -_-
So we settled for this place.
This place is huge inside, decked out in Giants & Warriors swag!
Reminded me of a turu-turu, the food is in front of you VIA cafeteria style. 

The employees were too busy talking to each other even after they looked at us they kept their little conversation going before finally asking us if we were ready.
BTW; we did look ready since WE WERE STARVING!

I ordered the Cheese Quesadilla, simple.
When we got to the cashier, we paid & were given a small basket of chips. Just chips, no salsa or anything.

We got the Coke in a bottle to drink :)
They gave us a number to put on the table.

Our food came out quick. My quesadilla was surprisingly bigger than I expected :) I asked for Guac on the side (not bad) It was good, how can you really go wrong with it? Just sayin'

They had TV's on playing ESPN so that is always a PLUS!

I saw people leave their dishes on their table & leave, then I also saw people put their dishes in the bus carts, we opted for that. 

Their bathrooms are only on stalls, FYI.

All in all, it was okay.

excerpts: I ordered 2 crispy tacos with chicken, a cheese quesadilla (which is one tortilla, not 2) and a small chips and salsa.
It came out to over $26 dollars I was shocked.
I canceled the chips and salsa and came out to $24.
When I got my receipt I was charged for a large salsa for $3.
I questioned why that was on my bill since I canceled any salsa I ordered and she rolled her eyes and gave me my $3 back.
When I got home, I opened the box to find my tacos were not crispy as I ordered, but soft.
Next time I have a Mexican Food craving, I'm going to Victors which is way better a block away.
Don't waste your money.
quesadilla.author: Micky C.
quesadilla.review: I'm pretty disappointed. I just got myself lunch from this place and brought $25 cash thinking that would be more than enough for lunch for 1 person. I ordered 2 crispy tacos with chicken, a cheese quesadilla (which is one tortilla, not 2) and a small chips and salsa. It came out to over $26 dollars I was shocked. I canceled the chips and salsa and came out to $24. When I got my receipt I was charged for a large salsa for $3. I questioned why that was on my bill since I canceled any salsa I ordered and she rolled her eyes and gave me my $3 back. When I got home, I opened the box to find my tacos were not crispy as I ordered, but soft. Next time I have a Mexican Food craving, I'm going to Victors which is way better a block away. Don't waste your money.

excerpts: Fish Tacos, Beef Tacos & Quesadilla Carnitas
Total:  $20.73
quesadilla.author: Genevieve Y.
quesadilla.review:
Date & Time:  Wednesday October 21, 2009 @ 6:30pm Opening Day
Company:  Mommy & Michael
Crowd:  Neighborhood Condo-Dwellers & Young Families w/ Mclaren Strollers
Vibe:  Chill
Music:  Salsa
Decor:  Rustic.  Communal Tables, Bench-Seating &  Charming Back Patio
Service:  Nice & Friendly
Imbibe:  Horchata.   Wine & Beer Available
Devour:  Fish Tacos, Beef Tacos & Quesadilla Carnitas

excerpts: The super  quesadilla w/pastor was great.
Can't say the same for the super taco.
3 for service since my order is wrong half the time.
But otherwise great the food, beer selection, and a place to watch sports.
quesadilla.author: JJ S.
quesadilla.review: The super  quesadilla w/pastor was great. Can't say the same for the super taco. 3 for service since my order is wrong half the time. But otherwise great the food, beer selection, and a place to watch sports.

excerpts: Due to the dry meat, my quesadilla was dry.
The rice is sort of bland, though it is properly cooked, unlike Primo Patio down the street (I still shudder when I think of the horrific rice I was served there).
The black beans were enjoyable since they were they only non-dry thing on my plate.
quesadilla.author: Beatrice W.
quesadilla.review:
2.5 stars.  If you're craving Mexican just hold out til you can make a trip to the Mission.  

By definition, Al Pastor is marinated pork.  Well, the Al Pastor at the Iron Cactus is dried out beyond belief!  I've noticed other Yelpers have commented that the chicken is dry as well so I'm guessing this is pretty standard.  Due to the dry meat, my quesadilla was dry.  The rice is sort of bland, though it is properly cooked, unlike Primo Patio down the street (I still shudder when I think of the horrific rice I was served there).  The black beans were enjoyable since they were they only non-dry thing on my plate.

excerpts: Quesadilla de camarones tipped the tabnels at "awesome" - lots of shrimp, good cheese to shrimp ratio, not overcooked.
quesadilla.author: CJ G.
quesadilla.review:
Iron Cactus is a una gran adición al vecindario (great addition to the neighborhood).

Conveniently located within a block of CalTrain, Safeway, and ATT Park, Iron Cactus brings good, although gringo-ized Mexican food to South Beach.  The unassuming exterior belies the soaring ceilings and brick walls inside:  while not exactly "cozy," the space is homey - warm, inviting, and clean.

Let's get it straight:  Iron Cactus is not competing with dive Mexican places in The Mission.  Situated in South Beach, it caters to more refined tastes than the traditional taqueria at 16th and Mission.  Yes, the offerings may not be as spicy as El Farolito or Pancho Villa, but they are also not as greasy, nor as dangerous to your health - organic and sustainable where possible, the establishment uses ingredients that won't kill you.

The menu sticks to the basics:  burritos, tacos, quesadillas, etc.  There is nothing inventive here, and it is just as well.  In a setting such as this, diners are looking for tried and true favorites, not foamed creations from Ferran Adrià from El Bulli.

Patrons cannot go wrong with any of the burritos, quesadillas, or salads from Iron Cactus:   as in any Mexican restaurant worth its salt, you choose your meat, choose your tortilla, choose your beans, and choose your level of spiciness.  The result is pure Americanized, Mexican goodness.  Yes, not as spicy as some. Yes, not as greasy as some.  Yes, not as Hispanic as some.  But, hey, this is South Beach, not The Mission.

A burrito de pollo asado was quite tasty.  Yes, even though ordered "picante," it could have been spicier, it was still good.  Chicken Caesar was great:  crispy Romaine lettuce, spicy pollo asado, and light dressing.  Quesadilla de camarones tipped the tabnels at "awesome" - lots of shrimp, good cheese to shrimp ratio, not overcooked. 

Happy hours rock:  cheap beer and cheap tacos. Need I say more?

Service es muy bueno:  everyone is polite, service-oriented, and just all around nice.  Drinks consists of sodas, beers (both by the bottle and on tap), and some wines.

Want greasy, cheap Mexican food?  Go to The Mission.  Want good, healthy Mexican food that is convenient to where real people live, work, and commute, go to Iron Cactus.

excerpts: I usually have their Prawn Quesadilla or Chicken Quesadilla which are both pretty decent.
Their Super Nacho is totally disappointing to me because it's not dripping with cheese and other necessary ingredients to make it a "Super Nacho
quesadilla.author: Soozie H.
quesadilla.review:
I usually hit up The Iron Cactus is near my apartment and so I hit it up whenever I'm too lazy to drive and not wanting to cook in. It's decent Mexican and probably not much better than Taco Bell. I usually have their Prawn Quesadilla or Chicken Quesadilla which are both pretty decent. Their Super Nacho is totally disappointing to me because it's not dripping with cheese and other necessary ingredients to make it a "Super Nacho" the way it's shown on the menu. 

I think it's actually gotten a bit pricier from when they originally opened too.

excerpts: My chicken quesadilla order was taken and delivered with a smile.
Unfortunately it was made in a microwave.
They don't even try to hide the microwave from us, it's right there behind the counter -
I didn't notice 'til I got my awful dinner.
The cheese was molten lava hot, the tortilla soggy and the meat could not have possibly been cooked the same day.
quesadilla.author: Ian M.
quesadilla.review:
This place is a bummer.  
The food is barely edible.
I should have gone to McDonald's for a fast wrap.

It looks like the kind of place you could have a great burrito or some tacos and enjoy some chips, salsa and a beer or marg with friends.  The space is huge and decorated well with a great ambiance.  That is all it has going for it though.  

My chicken quesadilla order was taken and delivered with a smile.    Unfortunately it was made in a microwave.  They don't even try to hide the microwave from us, it's right there behind the counter - I didn't notice 'til I got my awful dinner.  The cheese was molten lava hot, the tortilla soggy and the meat could not have possibly been cooked the same day.  It was like chewing on chicken leather but with less flavor.

The chips and salsa were alright though.

Bottom line is a microwave has no business in a restaurant.  Ever.  EVER.  Food should have been recently prepared if not cooked just for me.  And this place blows.  

+1 star for at least looking like a good restaurant.

excerpts: The staff is friendly and attentive, and the food has always been great (I love the fish tacos, and my husband had great things to report on the shrimp quesadilla).
The interior decor is really cool, and I love how it is the only restaurant in the neighborhood where families with little kids seem to congregate.
quesadilla.author: Amber G.
quesadilla.review:
I love this place!

I SERIOUSLY do not understand what all the haters on here are talking about. I've been here many times since first discovering it down the street from my house in December, and I have NEVER been disappointed. I mean, really--I know what good food is, and I just don't understand how so many people could be so far off about this place.

There is a dearth of Mexican food in my neighborhood, so I jumped at the chance to go here when I found it. The staff is friendly and attentive, and the food has always been great (I love the fish tacos, and my husband had great things to report on the shrimp quesadilla). The interior decor is really cool, and I love how it is the only restaurant in the neighborhood where families with little kids seem to congregate. It makes the neighborhood seem like more of a COMMUNITY, which, down in Mission Bay, is something we've been waiting for a long time.

I encourage you to try it out and have an open mind. I mean, really. If I complained half as much as the people who usually frequent Yelp do, I'd be a pretty miserable person--so please, take the negative reviews with a huge grain of salt.

excerpts: I paid 8 dollars for the quesadilla meal- which is hands down the best thing on the menu! .
quesadilla.author: Luigi A.
quesadilla.review: Great place if you don't live in the mission and more specifically if you DO  live in SOMA. It isn't the est Mexican in town but it is in this area..and it's so inexpensive! I paid 8 dollars for the quesadilla meal- which is hands down the best thing on the menu! . Plus, all you can eat chips and salsa and a block away from where I sleep... im in.

excerpts: I had kind of low expectations from some of the reviews here and was pleasantly surprised with my chicken quesadilla served with piping rice/beans/salsa...for $7.
Easily enough to fill me up and then some.
Enough to share.
quesadilla.author: Mike J.
quesadilla.review:
I live by the Iron Cactus and finally tried it today, was happy I did :)

I had kind of low expectations from some of the reviews here and was pleasantly surprised with my chicken quesadilla served with piping rice/beans/salsa...for $7.   Easily enough to fill me up and then some.  Enough to share.  A nice step up from a chain like chipotle, for example.  

I give the food 3 stars and 1 star for atmosphere, friendly staff and happy hour specials!  If they could improve the food a tad  it could be a 5 star joint!  Until then it might be a spot for a quick lunch instead of happy hour or dinner out.  Hope it gets there!

Nap time :)

excerpts: I've been here a couple of times to get my fix of burritos or quesadilla's and each time I've been underwhelmed or simply appeased.
quesadilla.author: Aaron M.
quesadilla.review:
If three stars stand for solid, two stars means it's a hit and miss sorta place. I've been here a couple of times to get my fix of burritos or quesadilla's and each time I've been underwhelmed or simply appeased.

It's not a fancy place and the food is just okay, a bit overpriced for the assembly-line quality you recieved.  If there is a redeeming quality they've got a fair selection of drafts on tap from Sam Adams (a hard brew to find in the city) and Negra Modelo among others.

Unfortunately I haven't found much better in the neighborhood that compares price-wise. So for now... You'll do.

excerpts: Order a regular quesadilla with carnitas.
quesadilla.author: Jakob B.
quesadilla.review: Walk in. Long line. Order a regular quesadilla with carnitas. Receive a regular burrito with carnitas. First bite... Rice. second bite... Rice. Third bite... Rice. Come on! Fourth bite... Fat! Probably the worst burrito I've had. I gave them one star cause the coca cola was cold. -__-

excerpts: I was unsatisfied with every dish I tried: flavorless fish tacos, stale, over cooked chicken, tasteless cheese quesadilla, and the worst guacamole ever to grace my tongue.
quesadilla.author: Raquel T.
quesadilla.review:
It's a darn shame that these folks have such a wonderful location and decor, yet have some how managed to completely butcher Mexican cuisine. 

In San Francisco, where one can get the best tacos, burritos and salsas for dirt cheap, it's difficult to try and compete. Unless you're positive you have a unique flair or at least have mastered the art of cooking delicious Mexican, than why bother?

I wouldn't recommend eating here. I was unsatisfied with every dish I tried: flavorless fish tacos, stale, over cooked chicken, tasteless cheese quesadilla, and the worst guacamole ever to grace my tongue. (The Costco brand does it better.)

My recommendation to the owners - don't waste your space - find a new chef!

PS- On a side note I just found out my wallet was stolen from the register where I left it behind. Usually it's put in a lost in found especially when it's sitting at the register, but come to find out that they're completely not responsive to my request to find it. Coincidentally all charges were made at nearby locations just after there location closes. VERY DISAPPOINTING ALL AROUND.

excerpts: so i ordered a quesadilla.
the cashier was a very friendly lady.
we went to sit down and noticed other people around us had chips
and we didn't have any...eventually they were delivered but right before our meal came.
i was a little concerned over the runner as he is the same person bussing and cleaning tables.
i worked in the food and beverage industry and i know better than to have my busser run food out without cleaning his hands.
but we got our food and
it looked amazing.
i thought it was pretty good for the price i pay.
i enjoyed the spanish rice very much.
and the decor and furniture was definitely different.
i liked the feel of the place, very spacious and welcoming.
quesadilla.author: Zara-Maria S.
quesadilla.review: so me and my coworker tried this place out during our lunch break. we go in and was a little confused as to where to order but a gentleman at the counter called us over. the menu is pretty basic so i ordered a quesadilla. the cashier was a very friendly lady. we went to sit down and noticed other people around us had chips and we didn't have any...eventually they were delivered but right before our meal came. i was a little concerned over the runner as he is the same person bussing and cleaning tables. i worked in the food and beverage industry and i know better than to have my busser run food out without cleaning his hands. but we got our food and it looked amazing. i thought it was pretty good for the price i pay. i enjoyed the spanish rice very much. and the decor and furniture was definitely different. i liked the feel of the place, very spacious and welcoming.

excerpts: Fill in order for a chicken quesadilla ($6.50) and fax.
Walk to bank to kill time.
Go into IC, up to register to pay, expecting my food to be ready.
Well, they hadn't checked the fax machine.
He pulls the order, and doesn't ask me any questions about it, but hands it to the lady to make the food.
After a 5 minute wait (fine), she is boxing it up and asks me if I want it regular or super.
I said, I don't know what the difference is...the fax order form didn't specify one way or another, and homeboy didn't ask me when he first looked at it.
I said, regular I guess.
She gets this look like "they are going to dock my paycheck if I have to redo this", meaning she had made a super.
So I say fine, I'll take the super.
And so the cashier/manager charges me for a super!
quesadilla.author: Jennifer L.
quesadilla.review:
Food is decent.  

Service - well, this incident caused me to create a yelp account.  Ok, it wasn't THAT bad, but nonetheless.  Go online, print out fax order form.  Fill in order for a chicken quesadilla ($6.50) and fax.  Walk to bank to kill time.  Go into IC, up to register to pay, expecting my food to be ready.  Well, they hadn't checked the fax machine.  He pulls the order, and doesn't ask me any questions about it, but hands it to the lady to make the food.  After a 5 minute wait (fine), she is boxing it up and asks me if I want it regular or super.  I said, I don't know what the difference is...the fax order form didn't specify one way or another, and homeboy didn't ask me when he first looked at it.  I said, regular I guess.  She gets this look like "they are going to dock my paycheck if I have to redo this", meaning she had made a super.  So I say fine, I'll take the super.  And so the cashier/manager charges me for a super!  I roll my eyes, too hungry to argue, and walk out paying $9.30.  

Tips for IC:  
1)  Put your fax machine in a place where your employees can see it.  
2)  Tell your cashier that "it is really busy today" is not that great of an excuse.
3)  Allow your cashier the authority to give me a break (should have charged me for regular) when clearly they had made a mistake.

cheese quesadilla.review:
